title: IDMS Active Directory (AD) Engineer
description:
**Responsibilities:**
**SUMMARY**
DIGIT is seeking an **Identity and Directory Management Services (IDMS) Active Directory (AD) Engineer** to support the design, administration, management, execution & maintenance of GSA’s Identity & Directory Management Services (IDMS) and Identity, Credential, and Access Management (ICAM) solutions to meet the needs of the enterprise users & the enterprise architecture. These services, systems, and capabilities include, but not limited to, directory services management, ICAM, privileged account management, Single Sign-On (SSO), Active Directory (AD) Domain Name System (DNS) services, Public Key Infrastructure (PKI), Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), auditing and log management, Continuous Diagnostics and Mitigation/Dynamic and Evolving Federal Enterprise Network Defense (CDM/DEFEND), and the management of appliances. GSA IT currently leverages Microsoft (MS) AD as the authoritative account management system.
As a leading provider of advanced information technology solutions and professional services to U.S. federal government agencies, is the prime for a $807m task order in support of the General Services Administration (GSA) Office of Digital Infrastructure Technologies (IDT) DIGIT (Digital Innovation for GSA Infrastructure Technologies) task order driving digital transformation and delivering continuous improvement and business value to its customers. The team is comprised of the best-in-class technology partners to leverage forward-leaning technologies and best practices to transform GSA’s IT capabilities and shift offerings to provide a more flexible service delivery model, completing the agency’s shift to a fully digital experience along with its adoption of advanced, emerging technologies such as intelligent automation, artificial intelligence, and machine learning.
**RESPONSIBILITIES**
This position shall perform the following (to include but not limited to) activities:
* Active Directory including but not limited to:
	+ Microsoft Active Directory
	+ Azure Active Directory
	+ NetIQ DRA
	+ NetIQ Group Policy Administrator (GPA)
	+ Active Directory Lightweight Directory Services
	+ Vulnerability Mitigation
* Hands-on experience with cloud computing services (O365/Microsoft Azure/AWS).
* Experience with network architecture.
* Powershell, java and .NET scripting.
* An understanding of Zero Trust concepts.
* Strong experience with Directories, SSO, Federation, Delegated administration, API gateways, SOA services.
* Monitoring and maintaining the Service Now ticketing system
* Strong communication skills with customers over phone, email, or ticketing system.
* Must be willing to work a variety of shifts, including holidays as scheduled.
* Providing on-call rotation support on a routine basis.

  

**Qualifications:**
**CONTRACT REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS**
This following are REQUIRED for this position:
* Public Trust Clearance by start date.


* ITILv4 Foundation Training and ITILv4 Foundation Certification, may be obtained within 120 days after hire.


* Expertise in Powershell, java and .NET scripting.


* Considered Senior Active Directory Engineer.


* Applies fundamental concepts, processes, practices, and procedures on technical assignments. Performs work that requires practical experience and training. Work is performed under supervision.


* Proven ability to work independently in a full and/or partial remote environment with limited supervision and may supervise/lead others.


* Possess the ability to communicate in both oral and written forms, demonstrating an ability to communicate effectively with all levels of staff as well as clients.


* Maintain standard working hours per the DIGIT contract and to be available for meetings, and other collaborative efforts during working hours.


* Demonstrated ability to apply comprehensive knowledge across key tasks and high impact assignments with the ability to use practical experience and training to determine how to accomplish tasks.


**CONTRACT DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS**
The following are DESIRED for this position:
Strong knowledge of the different identity and access management (IAM) concepts, technologies and authentication protocols.
* Public Key Infrastructure (PKI):
	+ Active Directory Certificate Services (AD CS).
	+ HID Credential Management System (CMS).
	+ HID ActivClient.
	+ Federal PIV/CAC.
	+ Safenet Hardware Security Module (HSM’s).
* Identity Management services operations including but not limited to
	+ SailPoint IdentityIQ
	+ SecureAuth
	+ SAML 2.0
	+ Forefront Identity Manager/Microsoft Identity Manager
	+ Active Directory Federation Services
* Proficiency in the Google Suite (Gmail, Calendar, Chat, Meet, Docs, Slides, Sheets), Slack, and ServiceNow.


* Must be willing to work a variety of shifts, including holidays as scheduled.


**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE**
The following are the education and experience required for this position:
- 7 - 12 years of experience and bachelor's degree
* Experience as a remote worker demonstrating time management and self discipline with cultural change management and Agile mindset.

title: Model-Based Systems Engineer - Junior
description:
**Secure our Nation, Ignite your Future**

**Summary:**


ManTech International offers a unique opportunity to work on innovative projects that contribute to our national security. As a trusted leader in the industry, we prioritize our employees' growth and development. We are currently looking for a **Model-Based System Engineer - Junior** to join our remote team. In this role, you will work with a team of Model-Based Systems Engineers, supporting the Navy's digital transformation initiatives. Projects will encompass creating models for cybersecurity assessments, implementing MBSE approaches, and enhancing MBSE tools for Navy programs.

**Position Overview:**


As a **Model-Based System Engineer - Junior**, you will have the exciting opportunity to:

* Develop, integrate, and simulate digital models of Navy systems.
* Extract and abstract data from Navy technical documents for system models.
* Utilize Cameo Systems Modeler to construct representative Navy platform, system, and process models.
* Create models to support various analysis methods tailored to customer requirements.

**Experience Level/Education/Clearance Requirements:**

* 1-3 years of professional experience.
* Bachelor's Degree (BS) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, Systems Engineering, or a related field from an ABET-accredited program.
* Proficiency in distributed team collaboration.
* Strong written communication, interpersonal, problem-solving, analytical, mathematical, and organizational skills.
* Demonstrated use of Microsoft Office products for budgeting, reporting, and presentations.
* Exceptional attention to detail and writing skills.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience with Magic Draw, Cameo Systems Modeler, CATiA, or other SysML/Modeling tools.
* Familiarity with shipboard control systems, information technology, and network infrastructure.
* Understanding of object-oriented programming principles.
* OCSMP SysML Certifications.
* Strong preference for candidates with experience modeling or simulating Naval applications or similar domains.

**Clearance Requirements:**

* Requires the ability to obtain and maintain a Secret Clearance.
* United States Citizen.

**Physical Requirements:**

* This 100% remote position requires work from a home office or another suitable remote location.
* The role involves extended periods of stationary work at a desk or computer.

**Location:** 100% Remote


ManTech values innovation, creativity, and excellence. As a member of our team, you will contribute to cutting-edge projects with a meaningful impact. Join us today to elevate your career to new heights.

**Apply now and become part of our community of talented professionals!**


The projected compensation range for this position is $56,200-$93,300. There are differentiating factors that can impact a final salary/hourly rate, including, but not limited to, Contract Wage Determination, relevant work experience, skills and competencies that align to the specified role, geographic location (For Remote Opportunities), education and certifications as well as Federal Government Contract Labor categories. In addition, ManTech invests in it’s employees beyond just compensation. ManTech’s benefits offerings include, dependent upon position, Health Insurance, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, Holiday Pay, Short Term and Long Term Disability, Retirement and Savings, Learning and Development opportunities, wellness programs as well as other optional benefit elections.
For all positions requiring access to technology/software source code that is subject to export control laws, employment with the company is contingent on either verifying U.S.-person status or obtaining any necessary license. The applicant will be required to answer certain questions for export control purposes, and that information will be reviewed by compliance personnel to ensure compliance with federal law. ManTech may choose not to apply for a license for such individuals whose access to export-controlled technology or software source code may require authorization and may decline to proceed with an applicant on that basis alone.


ManTech International Corporation, as well as its subsidiaries proactively fulfills its role as an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, marital status, physical or mental disability, status as a Disabled Veteran, Recently Separated Veteran, Active Duty Wartime or Campaign Badge Veteran, Armed Forces Services Medal, or any other characteristic protected by law.


If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a position with ManTech through its online applicant system, please contact ManTech's Corporate EEO Department at (703) 218-6000. ManTech is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer - minorities, females, disabled and protected veterans are urged to apply. ManTech's utilization of any external recruitment or job placement agency is predicated upon its full compliance with our equal opportunity/affirmative action policies. ManTech does not accept resumes from unsolicited recruiting firms. We pay no fees for unsolicited services.


If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request an accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access http://www.mantech.com/careers/Pages/careers.aspx as a result of your disability. To request an accommodation please click careers@mantech.com and provide your name and contact information.

title: Associate Mfg Systems Engineer- Automation Engineering
description:
**HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?**


You’ve worked hard to become the professional you are today and are now ready to take the next step in your career. How will you put your skills, experience and passion to work toward your goals? At Amgen, our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies, reaching over 10 million patients worldwide. Come do your best work alongside other innovative, driven professionals in this meaningful role.


Associate Mfg Systems Engineer- Automation Engineering

**Live**
--------

**What you will do**


Let’s do this. Let’s change the world. In this role the Associate Mfg Systems Engineer for the new Amgen Advanced Assembly and Final Product Operation facility will be part of the Facilities & Engineering team responsible for providing automation and technical support for the safe and reliable operation of our advanced automated warehouse and automated guided vehicle systems (Automated storage and retrieval System - ASRS). You will have the phenomenal opportunity to support performing advanced installation, trouble shooting, maintenance, repair, testing, and documentation/logs of our advanced warehouse automation systems that require strong analytical problem-solving techniques.

**Specific Responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
-------------------------------------------------------------

* Strictly follow the company’s safety and cGMP policies and procedures.
* Provide operational shift support for process control applications applying Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC), Human Machine Interfaces (HMI), Variable Frequency Drives (VFD) and vision systems.
* Apply engineering principles of process automation to provide technical support to the automated warehouse, automated guided vehicles, and manufacturing production.
* Implement control system trouble shooting support for the ASRS integrated system.
* Implement automated process changes to improved equipment performance or upgraded equipment technologies.
* Participate in technical root cause analysis, incident investigations, and trouble shooting on automation control issues related to electrical, instrumentation, and control systems.
* Perform required work in a GMP regulated manufacturing setting.
* Implement Preventative and Corrective maintenance.
* Ensure strict alignment to Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) and maintain accurate GMP documentation following ALCOA+ principles.
* Support project management efforts for automation-related projects.
* Handle Automation Systems lifecycle including controlled changes, software versioning, and control system qualification. Ensure all changes are properly documented and approved.
* Support Data Integrity Assessments.
* Maintain automated warehouse systems applying Allen Bradley Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC), Human Machine Interfaces (HMI) and Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition systems (SCADA).
* Support Continuous Improvement initiatives including Safety, Reliability, Efficiency and Environmental sustainability improvements to meet Amgen’s goals.
* Business Process Improvements including departmental Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) and Job plans for the area of responsibility to assure all maintenance operations are performed safely and reliably.

**Win**
-------

**What we expect of you**


We are all different, yet we all use our unique contributions to serve patients. The automation professional we seek will possess these qualifications.

**Basic Qualifications:**
-------------------------


Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a technical field with automation


OR


Associate’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a technical field with automation and 4 years of automation experience

**Or**
------


High school diploma / GED and 6 years of automation experience

**Preferred Qualifications:**
-----------------------------

* Degree Engineering, Computer Science or a technical field with 2 years of automation experience.
* Ability to read and update electrical design packages including User Requirements (URS), Functional Specifications (FS), Design Specifications (DS), wiring diagrams, and P&ID.
* Proficient in PLC Controller and HMI programming skills (preferred Allen Bradley).
* Strong technical writing, communication, and presentation skills.
* Project Management and implementation experience.
* Flexibility to work nonstandard shifts to support 24/7 operations.
* Experience in an FDA (GMP) or comparable regulated environment preferably Pharmaceutical and/or Biotechnology industry
* Strong automation and/or systems capability
* Allen Bradley Automation SCADA and PLC Platform.
* Ability to work to tight deadlines in a fast paced environment

**Thrive**
----------

**What you can expect of us**


As we work to develop treatments that take care of others, we also work to care for our teammates’ professional and personal growth and well-being.


Amgen offers a Total Rewards Plan comprising health and welfare plans for staff and eligible dependents, financial plans with opportunities to save towards retirement or other goals, work/life balance, and career development opportunities including:

* Comprehensive employee benefits package, including a Retirement and Savings Plan with generous company contributions, group medical, dental and vision coverage, life and disability insurance, and flexible spending accounts.
* A discretionary annual bonus program, or for field sales representatives, a sales-based incentive plan
* Stock-based long-term incentives
* Award-winning time-off plans and bi-annual company-wide shutdowns
* Flexible work models, including remote work arrangements, where possible

**Apply now**
-------------

**for a career that defies imagination**


Objects in your future are closer than they appear. Join us.

**careers.amgen.com**
---------------------


Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Systems Engineer - US Based Remote
description:
Join our Anywhere Real Estate Inc's team where as a System Engineer, you will work closely with customers, vendor support groups, Information Technology teams, and service providers to ensure detailed resolution of incidents. We need someone who will follow industry best practices, implement and enforce to standards, and ensure timely remediation of vulnerabilities. This role works with the Systems Engineering Manager.
**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Leads all aspects of multiple VMWare Vcenter environments.
* Build and maintain VMWare ESX Servers.
* Build and maintain Microsoft servers and clusters on physical machines, virtual machines, and in the cloud.
* Assist with building and configuring IaaS and PaaS cloud services using JSON scripts or other deployment methods.
* Respond to incidents based on automated alerts and notifications from an offshore support team, including participation in an on-call rotation.
* Participate in projects by attending project meetings and delivering on tasks as assigned.
* Streamline deployment processes for cloud infrastructure using innovative techniques, reducing deployment times, and improving overall operational efficiency.
* Storage management

**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in STEM related field or 5+ equivalent years of experience supporting a large, complex, and diverse environment.
* Phenomenal problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and excellent analytical ability
* Excellent judgment and dedication to high levels of customer happiness.
* A broad base of technical knowledge including:
* VMWare vSphere, vCenter, VSAN, and Horizon.
* Blade and server technologies such as Dell or Cisco UCS.
* Microsoft Windows Server and clustering.
* Storage area networks (Netapp, Pure).
* Virtual machines and related resources in Azure and Amazon Web Services.

**Preferred qualifications**

* Technical knowledge of backup software, with an emphasis on Commvault backups.
* Proficiency with Linux operating systems, including Red Hat and Ubuntu.
* Familiarity with industry security standards, including Center for Internet Security benchmarks.
* Certifications in Azure and AWS infrastructure management
  

  

#LI-DH2
  

#LI-Remote

  

  

**Exciting News:**  

  

**EEO Statement:** EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability
  

  

**Compensation Range:**$97,000 - $130,000 ; At Anywhere, actual compensation within that range will be dependent upon the individual’s skills, experience, and qualifications.

title: Remote Systems Engineer
description:
**Remote Systems Engineer:** MUST live in Southern CA
  
  

Contract to Hire - candidates must be U.S Citizen or Green Card Holder. Not able to support C2C at this time.
  
  

100% REMOTE. \\*\\*\\*You MUST be able to travel to San Diego a few times a year for company events and meetings \\*\\*\\*
  
  

Job Summary
  
  

The role of the Systems Engineer is to maintain the system operations following all regulatory requirements with a primary focus on confidentiality and HIPPA security regulations. Our client is a world renowned hospital in Sothern CA and this position will lead to a full time opportunity with them. You will be working directly with the CTO.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Perform daily maintenance operations of the Server, storage, and virtual application delivery infrastructure
* Actively communicating changes within the IT infrastructure to all affected parties effectively
* Establishing and maintaining strict testing and deployment methodologies for Information Systems
* Designing and implementing the processes to establish and maintain appropriately available computer systems operations environment, including controlled observation and evaluation of new technologies and methodologies
* Using monitoring tools and statistical analysis to manage system capacity, working alongside Technical Operations Center (TOC) staff to maintain the TOC support on-site at the Data Center 24/7
* Identify opportunities to improve the efficiency and productivity of current processes and procedures, and assist peers by sharing technical knowledge and best practices
* Periodically be able to be onsite.


Qualifications
  
  

* 5+ years experience as a systems engineer, working in enterprise environments.
* Be able and willing to periodically (6-8 times a year) come down to San Diego and be onsite for the day. This is not negotiable.
* Extensive experience with Windows operating systems, AD (Active Directory), DHCP, DNS (Domain Name System), FTP (File Transfer Protocol), TFTP, SMTP, SNMP (Simple Network Management Protocol), printers, scanners, profile and version management, and experience with system design, capacity planning, and capacity management
* Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Information Systems, Computer Engineering, or related field or equivalent work experience.
* Hands-on experience with:
* o Storage Solutions Nutanix HCI, Compellent, NetApp, ECS
* o Storage Technologies RAID, HBA, ZFS, DAS, NAS, SAN, MPIO
* o Virtualization VMware vSphere, Acropolis Hyper Visor
* o Virtual Desktop Infrastructure Citrix
* o Server OS Windows 2012R2, 2016, 2019, 2022, Enterprise Linux, SUSE, and Ubuntu 18+
* o Services Active Directory, Azure cloud services, Cert Enrollment, Active Directory Federation Services
* o Scripting PowerShell, Bash, Python o Automation Ansible, Chef, Puppet, Azure Automation, Power Automate
* o Cloud solutions OneDrive, Azure Files, Snowball, Serverless compute
* o DevSecOps/Automation


This is an immediate need and will lead to a full time position with excellent benefits and 401K for a world renown medical institution. If you are a qualified US Citizen or GC Holder, please apply now and send your resume to danieln@noorstaffing.com
  
  

#danieln

title: Systems Engineer - SCCM/MECM/Endpoint - Remote
description:
**Systems Engineer - SCCM/MECM/Endpoint**

**Who we are:**


At Lifepoint Health, we provide quality healthcare to rural communities. As a valued member of our team, you will be an integral part of a group working together to elevate Lifepoint's healthcare delivery network. Our network includes 60+ community hospitals, 60+ rehabilitation/behavioral health hospitals, and 250 additional sites of care across the United States. As an organization, we are dedicated to serving communities nationwide by providing exceptional care. We believe in the power of our talented teams and strive to create environments where employees find purpose and fulfillment.

**What you’ll do:**


As a **Systems Engineer specializing in SCCM/MECM/Endpoint**, you contribute to and perform tasks within assigned ITS departmental areas to support Lifepoint’s Operating Systems, Infrastructure, and Middleware. You ensure that tasks meet ITS/Business expectations and Customer Service Level Agreements. Additionally, you participate in projects requiring departmental involvement and provide education/guidance to less experienced team members.

**Responsibilities:**

* Manages departmental projects, ensuring clear definition, systematic execution, full documentation, and business-oriented results.
* Executes migration strategies to future technical architecture.
* Participates in testing and selection of new systems and infrastructure projects.
* Supports operational procedures and standards, following vendor best practices.
* Certifies, installs, configures, and maintains LifePoint Windows server systems.
* Every 4-6 weeks, provides 24/7 on-call support and basic triage for department areas.
* Defines configuration specifications for new systems based on requirements.
* Performs root cause analysis of system failures, makes recommendations for performance improvements, and communicates issues within the department.

 **What you’ll need:**

**Education**: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience in Information Systems  

**Experience**: 2+ years of experience  

**Certifications**: MCSA or MCSE preferred

**Why choose us:**

As a team member of the Health Support Center, our goal is to support those that are in our facilities who are interfacing and providing care to our patients and community members. Our focus is to attract, retain, and empower a diverse and determined workforce. Our mission statement is at the heart of who we are and what we do: “Making Communities Healthier.” In this shared mission, we believe that our collective efforts will shape a healthier future for the communities we serve.

**Benefits:** We offer an excellent total compensation package, including a competitive salary and benefits. Some of our benefits include 401k, flexible PTO, generous Employee illness benefit (EIB), medical, dental, vision, tuition reimbursement, and an Employee Assistance Program. We believe that happy, healthy people have a passionate engagement with life and work and have designed our package to enhance your wellbeing.

 **Equal opportunity and affirmative action employers and are looking for diversity in candidates for employment: Minority/Female/Disabled/Protected Veteran**

title: SharePoint Engineer
description:

You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and ensure the successful delivery of Sharepoint projects. title: L3 Aruba Wireless Engineer (VA, Remote + Travel)
description:
Request Title: L3 Aruba Wireless Engineer  
Desired Start Date: 3/25/2024  
Duration: 5 Months, Hrs/Wk:40.00  
Work Location: Richmond, VA (Remote + Travels)

Description:

This role will be for an L3 Remote based, US resource. **There will be required travel for surveys**, etc. The role will be **30-40 hours weekly** variable based on workload (expect more in the 35-40 hour range)  
Overview:  
The Senior Wireless Network Engineer must be a detail oriented, committed problem solver with robust communication skills who will execute the vision through the design and oversight of a web and mobile application platform. Responsible for setup and installation of technical systems, applications, or process designs for client’s purchased or outsourced technology and business process solutions. Works directly with client to manage initial access, map and transfer data, create process documentation, and train or coordinate training for client users. Tests and troubleshoots functionality of installed systems; identifies and documents technical issues to be escalated to product and system integration teams for resolution. Provides feedback based on client experiences to product and professional services teams for product and process improvements. **Experience working for a Global multi-national corporation**. **MUST have Highly skilled with performing on-site Wireless survey s for AP placement.** 

**Must have strong experience with Aruba Wireless and Ekahau Sidekick 2 survey tools**

Required Experience:  
1. **Must have 8-10 years of experience in specification, design, development, and deployment of digital wireless networks and communication systems** inclusive of :  
o Wireless Pre-Design Site Visit, Wireless Predictive Design, Wireless Post Installation Survey, & APoS Surveys.  
o **Knowledge of 802.11 standards, CAPWAP, Cisco WLC**; be able to use tools such as **Cisco Prime Infrastructure, AirMagnet Spectrum, Ekahau Pro, or other Survey and RF tools**, to design and support WLANS.  
o Interact with clients on site to meet complex requirements of a solution.  
o Escalate unresolved problems and issues to the relevant third parties.  
o Respond to escalated client requests and support client applications to a first line resolution.  
o Escalate complex problems to the relevant third parties.  
o Write reports and proposals and complete and maintain project documentation.  
o Assist with the documentation of standard operating procedures relating to installations and fixes.  
2. **Expert understanding of Aruba Wireless Network architecture, design, configuration, and operations is required.**  
o **Extensive practical knowledge of switching and routing protocols** (**OSPF, BGP, and EIGRP**).  
o Solid understanding of general Network and Security fundamentals.  
o Remotely supporting clients within service level agreements (SLAs),  
o Install and Configure software and hardware as well as resolve incidents,  
o Perform root cause analysis and adhere to any related processes such as change management.  
o Device and network performance analysis and troubleshooting skills  
3. Strong oral and written communication skills.  
4. Ability to lead technical discussions (internally and externally with vendors).  
5. Demonstrated technical success in a fast paced, results-oriented engineering environment.  
6. Ability to work independently, and **mentor others**.  
7. Possessing active certifications like: **HPE Aruba Certifications, CCIE Wireless, Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) Wireless or Certified Wireless Network Professional (CWNP), is a strong plus**.

\\*  
\\*  
\\*  
\\*

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $70.00 - $75.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Networking Engineer, Philippines - Remote - US EST hours
description:
**Introduction**  

At Slipstream IT we work to streamline IT Support and provide managed solutions with a strategic consulting and global leadership management approach. Our solutions are designed exclusively for emerging pharma and biotech organizations.  

  

Slipstream’s industry-leading solutions free clients from the demands of internal IT and allow them to rapidly advance their mission. Led by a leadership team that has been together for over 10 years, you will join a proven team, culture, and strategy to drive innovation within the IT outsourcing industry while developing your skillset with the opportunities for internal growth.


**Senior Network Engineer – Philippines - Remote – Eastern Time Zone working hours**


**The day-to-day:**


* Handling Ticket Escalations
* Updating service tickets.
* Working with teammates to assure timely resolution to client requests.
* Installing and configuring Local and Cloud Networking Environments
* Identify Client IT needs and work with team members to develop solutions.
* Be available at inconvenient times for upgrades, troubleshooting, etc. – hopefully not too often, but you know how it goes!


**Typical technical day-to-day:**


* Keep our customers safe by ensuring data accuracy, security, and regulatory compliance – that’s what it’s all about, right?
* Resolving escalated tickets.
* Create and maintain network topology, equipment, and configuration documentation for each customer.
* Perform network administration such as: network infrastructure installs, configuration management, network problem analysis and resolution, log analysis, etc. All the nerdy IT stuff!
* On board new clients by deploying network management tools. More nerdy stuff!
* Identify, diagnose, and resolve network problems including network connectivity, traffic utilization, etc.


**We are a great fit for you if you:**


* Strong background with various networking equipment brands, such as Palo Alto, FortiNet, Meraki, Cisco, etc.
* Have deployed, Supported, and designed networks within Azure or AWS.
* Design and implement core network infrastructure, routing, hybrid networking, private access and monitored networking.
* Have a nurturing personality and desire to help mentor your fellow team members.
* Are results-oriented, self-motivated, energetic, professional, and reliable.
* Are committed completing projects and tasks on schedule.
* Possess extraordinary customer service skills and strong multi-tasking, organizational, documentation, and time-management skills.
* Are comfortable working with clients of all kinds and have experience discovering business and technology needs. People need to feel heard and comfortable with our solutions – this stuff is complicated!
* Have a strong understanding of technology and business productivity systems.
* Already have 3+ years of experience working for a Managed Service Provider and 5+ years of hands-on experience configuring, designing, and troubleshooting network topologies.

**It would great if you have:**


* Experience working with cloud and virtualized environments such as Azure, AWS, and VMWare ESXi.
* Experience with Auvik Network Monitoring or other networking monitoring tools.
* Experience with Vulnerability Management tools focused on networking.


**Having one or more of these certifications would let us know you mean business:**


* Cisco Meraki Certification
* Cisco Expert-level Certification (CCIE or CCDE)
* Palo Alto Certifications (PCNSA, PCNSE, PCCSE, PCCET)
* Network Security Expert (NSE) Fortinet

title: Configuration Management Engineer
description:
**Job Title:** Configuration Management Engineer

**Job Location:** Remote 90% / DC 10%

 **Position Overview:** LSI requires the service of a Configuration Management Engineer to support a DOJ customer. The position will provide administration support for software package development, configuration management, and research and evaluate software and hardware technologies.

 **Essential Functions and Responsibilities:**

* Create a single network deployable operating system image in SCCM that can be used on multiple computer models and form factors, containing base applications and custom scripts.
* Create a single standalone operating system image in SCCM that can be deployed by external media and used on multiple computer models and form factors, containing base applications and custom scripts.
* Troubleshoot SCCM and Intune client connectivity and communications problems
* Troubleshoot SCCM and Intune application, patches, software updates, and operating system deployment problems
* Create custom reports and dashboards via SCCM’s reporting tool
* Perform routine system maintenance, including operating system upgrades and security patching on laptops, desktops, VMs, and servers utilizing SCCM and Intune.
* Assist system owners in other divisions and offices in triaging issues and escalating tickets as required.
* Develop, maintain, and debug current custom IT solutions and program code when needed.
* Produce and maintain technical documentation and related best practices regarding configuration management, network, and system design and governance.
* Creating and modifying domain objects, groups, and policies in Active Directory and Group Policy Management.
* Perform analysis on emerging application enhancements as a benefit to the business models.
* Provide input and best practice recommendations to current and future policies and procedures as needed or requested.
* Conduct internal technical reviews to improve performance, support, and technical enhancements.
* Work assigned service tickets and tasks IAW the Acceptable Quality Level (AQL).
* Develop standard operating procedures, knowledge base articles, technical bulletins, and other documents supporting the IT Division.
* Provide required certifications and resume for review and validation.
* Demonstrate leadership and can work without supervision.

 **Requirements:**

* A minimum of 5 years’ experience as a System Engineer (SCCM)
* A minimum of 1 year’s experience in Microsoft Intune.
* **Specific tools/experience areas:** Powershell, SQL query language, software distribution, and patching.
* **Required Certifications (Current):** Microsoft Certified Modern Desktop Administrator Associate, Endpoint Manager Administrator Associate, Administering Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager and Cloud Services Integration, and/or Administering and Deploying System Center Configuration Manager.
* **Education level:** Minimum Bachelor of Science degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field from a US Department of Education accredited University is required. Extensive and relevant experience may be considered as a substitute for education.
* **Soft skill qualifications:** Critical thinking, Problem-solving, Time management, Conflict resolution, Teamwork, Effective communication, Creative thinking, and Dependability.
* **Preferred Skillsets/Knowledge areas:**
	+ Expert knowledge of Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM)
	+ Prior experience with software package and patch deployment methodologies.
	+ Client Management and Troubleshooting.
	+ PowerShell Scripting.
	+ Active Directory and Group Policy.
	+ Security Best Practices.

title: Sr Network Engineer
description:
Invitae is a leading medical genetics company trusted by millions of patients and their providers to deliver timely genetic information using digital technology. We aim to provide accurate and actionable answers to strengthen medical decision-making for individuals and their families. Invitae's genetics experts apply a rigorous approach to data and research, serving as the foundation of their mission to bring comprehensive genetic information into mainstream medicine to improve healthcare for billions of people.

**About our team:**



Our mission is to provide all connectivity required by our employees to bring genetics into mainstream medicine, and ensure that our office's IT environment is reliable, and highly available.



The Networking team's responsibilities range from WAN, LAN and DC, embracing cross-team collaboration across Security, Engineering, IT, Cloud Operations and End user support teams.


**Responsibilities:**


* Contribute to the design, build, and support for all facets of our new offices and on-prem build outs.
* All things related to networking: implementation and maintenance for a variety of cloud based network technologies.
* Able to support our internal customers and provide exceptional support
* Work closely on initiatives and convert them into requirements for the team.
* Creating and defending High/Low Level Design documents, working with internal stakeholders to influence technology roadmaps.


**Technical Requirements:**


* A track record of network greenfield implementations, from the inception to post deployment support.
* Understanding of physical infrastructure design including structured, fiber-optic cabling.
* Expertise in Juniper switching (Virtual Chassis, MC-LAG), Cisco Switching (VPC, VSS, Switch Stacking) and PAN-OS (Palo Alto Networks firewalls and Panorama - virtual and physical), wireless.
* Proven experience managing multiple projects simultaneously and delivering against mission critical deadlines.
* Monitoring tools integration experience: Slack, Webhooks, Logic Monitor, Juniper Space and Palo Alto Networks Panorama.
* Working knowledge of Storage architectures to collaborate with Data Center Storage Infrastructure teams and VMware environments.
* Network Stack: Juniper, Palo Alto Networks, Mist, Cisco and Meraki, SD-WAN appliances.


**What you bring:**


* 5+ years of experience in TCP/IP networking;
* Expertise in TCP, IPv4/6, OSPF and BGP;
* Proficient familiarity with Cisco CLI ( IOS-XE, NX-OS), Junos and PAN-OS;
* Troubleshooting network issues in an environment with Windows, VMWare, Pure Storage, Vast Storage and an array of Bio-Medical laboratory systems;
* Open to travel for work, approximately 10-15%;
* Expertise in configuring and troubleshooting routing and switching protocols (BGP, OSPF, STP, VRRP).
* Understanding of network protocols (TCP/UDP, DHCP, DNS) and experience with IPv4 and IPv6.
* Linux experience to troubleshoot the life of a packet from client to server, packet captures, tracing, etc;
* Proficiency with Network Automation is a huge plus.

This salary range is an estimate, and the actual salary may vary based on a wide range of factors, including your skills, qualifications, experience and location. This position is eligible for benefits including but not limited to medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability coverage, flexible paid time off, Spring Health, Carrot Fertility, participation in a 401k with company match, ESPP, and many other additional voluntary benefits. Invitae also offers generous paid leave programs so you can spend time with your new child, recover from your own illness or care for a sick family member.**California Pay Range**


$105,200—$131,500 USD
Please apply even if you don't meet all of the "What you bring" requirements noted. It's rare that someone checks every single item, it's ok, we encourage you to apply anyways.



Join us!


*At Invitae, we value diversity and provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.*  

  

*We truly believe a diverse workplace is crucial to our company's success and to better serve our diverse patients. Your input is especially valuable. We'd greatly appreciate it if you can take a quick moment to make your selection(s) below. Submissions will be anonymous.*



You can find a detailed explanation of our privacy practices here.

title: Principal Atlassian Administrator
description:
Markforged (NYSE: MKFG) is reinventing the $1 trillion+ worldwide manufacturing industry so that engineers can build anything they imagine while reducing environmental impact. With the market's most robust 3D printing hardware, software and material solution, a world-class team, great customers and abundant capital, we're well placed to continue our growth and innovation.



As an individual contributor, you'll be focused on providing strong internal Atlassian tooling expertise to help our organization achieve its goals.


### **What will you own?**


* Manage the administration of Atlassian tools, including system configuration, user management, security settings, and integrations with other systems.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, analyze business processes, and design customized workflows, templates, and dashboards for Atlassian tools.
* Provide guidance and mentorship to junior Atlassian administrators, sharing best practices and promoting continuous improvement.
* Develop and maintain Atlassian dashboards, filters, and reports to provide actionable insights and facilitate decision-making for project teams and management.
* Ensure the integrity, reliability, and performance of the Atlassian tools through routine system maintenance, including upgrades, patches, and performance tuning.
* Collaborate with development teams to integrate Atlassian tools with other tools and systems, such as source control, build automation, and deployment tools.
* Evaluate and implement Atlassian plugins and integrations to enhance functionality and support evolving business requirements.
* Troubleshoot complex issues, provide timely resolution, and investigate system errors or anomalies.
* Conduct regular health checks and audits of the Atlassian tools to identify areas for improvement, optimize system configurations, and ensure adherence to best practices.
* Stay abreast of the latest Atlassian features, functionalities, and industry trends, and assess their applicability to enhance the organization's Atlassian capabilities.
* Serve as a subject matter expert and escalation point for Atlassian-related issues, providing guidance and support to users and project teams.
* Drive user adoption and deliver training sessions to promote efficient and effective utilization of Atlassian tools across the organization.

  


**Important Note:**



Although we list out what we generally look for, we are very likely missing other attributes and skills that you have that could make you a great fit, but are not currently listed. Research has shown this especially applies to women and other marginalized groups, who tend to apply if they check 100% of every box, versus men who apply if they hit roughly 60%. The point we're getting at, it doesn't hurt to take a chance and apply!


### **What you have:**


* Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
* 5+ years of proven experience as a Senior/Principal Atlassian Administrator or similar role, with a track record of successfully managing and enhancing Atlassian tools in enterprise environments.
* In-depth knowledge of Atlassian tools and their administration, specifically JSM (Jira Service Management). Also including JIRA, Confluence, Bitbucket, JWM, JSW, JPM, Trello, Atlas, Assist, Beacon, etc.
* Strong understanding of software development methodologies (Agile, Scrum, Kanban) and the software development life cycle (SDLC).
* Experience integrating Atlassian tools with other tools and systems, such as CI/CD, testing, and release management tools.
* Proficiency in Atlassian reporting and data visualization using JQL, gadgets, and dashboards.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to diagnose and resolve complex technical issues.
* Strong leadership and communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
* Proven ability to drive user adoption and deliver effective training sessions to technical and non-technical audiences.
* Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and projects effectively and efficiently.
* Experience with cloud-based Atlassian deployments, including AWS or Azure, is a plus.

title: Implementation Engineer
description:
If you are seeking a position with a strong team, focused on doing great things every day, with the opportunity to sell a wide array of technological solutions from the desktop to the data center, then join our team at ATS! We are looking for talented, creative individuals to help our customers solve problems.  

  

Applied Technology Services (ATS) is an IT systems integrator and has been a trusted partner to customers in the Mid-Atlantic region for 20 years. We have core competencies in Enterprise Modernization, Infrastructure Services, End User Computing, Workforce Optimization, Cyber Security Solutions, and IT Staffing. ATS provides a wide array of professional and managed services from the data center to the desktop. ATS holds minority certifications in Delaware, Maryland, the District of Columbia, Pennsylvania, and Virginia and is a Third-Party Certified Women Owned Small Business (WOSB)  

  

ATS is seeking to add an exceptionally skilled **Implementation Engineer** with expert knowledge of datacenter infrastructure to join our team. The main function of this resource will be the deployment of enterprise systems and the development of technical solutions as required by our customers. There will be travel in the mid-Atlantic region and some after-hours work. This is a full-time, hands-on, and remote position that requires:  

  

**Responsibilities**

* Design simple and complex architectures that address customers data center requirements.
* Collect customer requirements and conduct environmental assessments to identify potential problems or possible enhancements.
* Perform a Total Cost of Ownership analysis and provide alternatives to customers based on requirements and budget.
* Provide information about products and services, including performing or coordinating demonstrations.
* Provide training and knowledge on public, private and hybrid cloud options as well as datacenter optimization, redundancy, and high availability as required by the customer.
* Proactively engage with customers to provide guidance on datacenter best practices.
* Keep up to date on industry trends, cutting-edge technology, and new solutions for our customers’ needs.
* Complete Bill of Materials (BOM’s) for solutions alternatives
* Provide knowledge transfer, including documentation, to customers at the end of an engagement.
* Coordinate with external vendors and contractors to ensure projects are delivered as expected.
* Implement new data center technologies in the customers environment, including servers, storage, router, switches, firewalls, and security systems.
* Perform assessment, installation, and migration activities for newly implemented solutions.
* Conduct evaluations of customer’s existing technology to determine if it can be enhanced or improved.
* Learn to implement primary supported ATS technologies through coursework, shadowing and obtaining implementation certifications for identified manufacturers.
* In-depth understanding of datacenter connectivity, such as fiber optic cabling, Ethernet, and network aggregation
* Must be able to work as a team player and work independently.
* Analytical, results-driven and have a solution-oriented approach.
* Other duties as assigned.

  

**Requirements*** Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant STEM field including Information Systems, Engineering, Computer Science, or other relevant degrees.
* 7+ years of business/information/solution/technical architecture experience.
* Serve as a trusted partner for our customers, providing best practices and guidance on data center solutions.
* Hands-on experience with virtualization technologies, such as VMware or Hyper-V, and their impact on datacenter networking.
* Proficient with multi-vendor data center offerings, to include Dell, HPE, Nutanix, Cisco, Juniper, Aruba, VMware, and many others.
* Strong knowledge of datacenter routing and switching protocols, IP address mapping and VLAN
* Proficiency in designing and implementing complex datacenter LAN and WAN topologies, incorporating redundancy and fault tolerance.
* The ability to prioritize multiple projects and tasks.
* Ability to communicate effectively with the customer and document technical concepts.
* Possess exceptional interpersonal and communication skills including verbal, written presentation and listening.
* Ability to lift/carry weight up to 50 lbs.

**Full-Time Employee Benefits:**


* Competitive compensation
* Health benefits including Medical, Dental and Vision
* Vacation and Personal Days
* 401K
* Employee Assistance Plan
* Continuous education and learning opportunities.

title: Network Engineer - Remote
description:
CareDx, Inc. is a leading precision medicine solutions company focused on the discovery, development, and commercialization of clinically differentiated, high-value healthcare solutions for transplant patients and caregivers. CareDx offers products, testing services, and digital healthcare solutions along the pre- and post-transplant patient journey, and is the leading provider of genomics-based information for transplant patients.


 In the role of Network Engineer- remote, you will support the operation of our global network environment. The position is responsible for network maintenance, operation, and security. The service level requirements are high with a growing 24x7x365 lab operation. The requirements of the network are growing, and this role will provide input for network technology direction, development and support.  

  

**Responsibilities:**

* Support network capabilities for resiliency, performance, and scale in a complex, evolving environment.
* Implement, support, maintain and monitor routers, switches, firewalls, IPSec VPN tunnels, wireless access points, and IDS/IPS devices for stability, reliability, scalability and compliance.
* Implement and support network (WAN//LAN/SD-WAN) traffic analysis to diagnose and resolve issues for preventative maintenance.
* Develop and maintain detailed documentation of network equipment including routers, switches, firewalls, intrusion prevention systems, etc.
* Evaluate emerging network technology for security, monitoring, performance, reliability, and resiliency.
* Maintain awareness of regulatory and compliance requirements for network operations in a laboratory and patient care environment, meeting standards including HIPAA, CLIA, NIST, and others.
* Review and enhance internal network security procedures. Develop and maintain metrics to measure security program effectiveness.
* Monitor network performance, capacity, and tuning of related network components.
* Act as the point of escalation for all network related issues and facilitate troubleshooting and communication related to network issues/outages/escalations.
* Provide escalation support for critical network problems.
* All other duties as assigned by management.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Management Information Systems, Engineering, or related field a plus.
* 5-7 years in Networking with knowledge of server and desktop technologies.
* Experience in a healthcare regulated environment dealing with CLIA, HIPAA, and FDA requirements preferred
* CCNP, CCIE, PCNSE or other applicable certifications.
* Industry and vendor specific certifications and training (Cisco, Meraki, Aruba, etc)
* Working knowledge of ticketing systems – Examples: ServiceNow, Atlassian.
* Experience with Palo Alto, FTD, and FortiGate firewalls and VPN configurations, Aruba SD-WAN, Prisma Access, Meraki devices, Cisco Catalyst and Nexus switches, NAC, AAA, and RADIUS.
* Experience in networking technologies: IPv4/IPv6, BGP/OSPF, VPN, L2 switching, VLANs, VLAN aggregation, EtherChannel, PVLANs, Spanning Tree & Rapid Spanning Tree, 802.1Q.
* Demonstrated experience with high availability and performance networking environments.
* Demonstrated experience with networking across mixed on-prem, private cloud, and public cloud infrastructures.
* Experience with networking in highly virtualized environments and elastic compute infrastructure.
* Experience with network monitoring tools such as SolarWinds.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Management Information Systems, Engineering, or related field a plus.
* Experience in a healthcare regulated environment dealing with CLIA, HIPAA, and FDA requirements.
* CCNP, CCIE, PCNSE or other applicable certifications.
* Industry and vendor specific certifications and training (Cisco, Meraki, Aruba, etc)
* Working knowledge of ticketing systems – Examples: ServiceNow, Atlassian.

**Additional Details:**

*Every individual at CareDx has a direct impact on our collective mission to improve the lives of organ transplant patients worldwide. We believe in taking great care of our people, so they take even greater care of our patients.*


Our competitive Total Rewards package includes:

* Competitive base salary and incentive compensation
* Health and welfare benefits including a gym reimbursement program
* 401(k) savings plan match
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan
* Pre-tax commuter benefits
* And more!


In addition, we have a Living Donor Employee Recovery Policy that allows up to 30 days of paid leave annually to a full-time employee who makes the selfless act of donating an organ or bone marrow.

*With products that are making a difference in the lives of transplant patients today and a promising pipeline for the future, it’s an exciting time to be part of the CareDx team. Join us in partnering with transplant patients to transform our future together.*

*CareDx, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participates in the E-Verify program.*

*By proceeding with our application and submitting your information, you acknowledge that you have read our* *U.S. Personnel Privacy Notice**and consent to receive email communication from CareDx.*

title: Senior Trading Systems Engineer
description:
**About Us:-**

Since its founding in 2017, Prometheum has leveraged its deep expertise in securities law, blockchain and trading to create a compliant ecosystem for digital asset securities that enables all investors to seamlessly invest in digital assets securities. Prometheum has relied on its strong diverse team to build the tools to service digital asset securities. To date, Prometheum has built multiple broker-dealers traversing novel areas and a large technology stack (intersecting trading, blockchain, compliance, etc.). We continue to grow and are looking for hardworking hungry individuals that can contribute to our already great fintech company culture as we traverse new and exciting areas that require a thirst for solving complicated problems.

**Role:-**   
Senior Trading Systems Engineer - Full Time W2

**Salary Range:-**   
$180,000 - $250,000 (Base)

**Location:-**   
Fully remote, USA

**Position Summary:-**  
As a Senior Trading Systems Engineer at, you will be a pivotal part of our development team, focusing on the advancement and optimization of our trading platforms. Your deep expertise in limit-based order books, order management systems, trading APIs, and message queue/bus systems will be crucial in driving our trading efficiency and strengthening our position in the market. In collaboration with cross-functional teams, you will apply state-of-the-art technologies to keep us at the forefront of the trading industry.

**Key Responsibilities:-**

* Take a senior engineering position in the development and refinement of high-performance trading systems, with a particular focus on limit-based order books and order management systems.
* Lead the integration and management of trading APIs, including proprietary, FIX-based, and other protocols, ensuring seamless and robust market connectivity.
* Design and oversee the implementation of message queue and message bus systems optimizing for high throughput and low latency.
* Collaborate closely with the trading team to convert complex requirements into reliable and scalable technical solutions.
* Conduct thorough work with testing and QA to maintain system integrity and performance, preparing for and managing peak trading volumes.
* Proactively tackle system performance issues, devising and implementing solutions to enhance trading efficiency and effectiveness.

**Required Skills and Experience:-**

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical discipline.
* A minimum of 5 years of direct experience in trading systems development, with specific accomplishments in building limit-based order books, order management systems, trading APIs, and messaging systems.
* Proficiency in modern programming languages such as TypeScript, Go, Rust, C++, or similar, with a focus on low-latency and high-performance computing.
* Expert knowledge of message queue and message bus technologies, e.g. Kafka, RabbitMQ, ZeroMQ, and Redis Streams.
* Strong analytical skills and the ability to thrive in a high-pressure, fast-paced trading environment.
* Excellent communication skills, capable of working effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

**Desirable additional skills:-**

* Extensive experience with the FIX protocol and a proven track record of integrating with a variety of trading platforms and exchanges.
* Experience with cloud computing platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes).
* Background in financial markets, trading strategies, and quantitative analysis.
* Previous exposure to a high-frequency trading (HFT) environment.

**Benefits:-**

* Competitive salary based on experience.
* Excellent benefits including:- Health, Vision & Dental Insurance.
* Fully remote position with equipment provided.
* Visa sponsorship is possible for the right candidate.

*Prometheum is an equal opportunity employer.*

title: Test Engineer III - eCRM (Secret Clearance, US Citizenship required)
description:
To be fully considered for this position, please apply directly on our website at: https://katmaicorp.hua.hrsmart.com/hr/ats/Posting/view/3177

Job Title: Test Engineer III (eCRM)

Location: ORLANDO, FL 32826 US (Primary)  
Job Type: Full-time

Job Description

**SUMMARY**

Responsible for contributing to development of an enterprise portal serving 1M users using Test methodology, focusing equally on user experience, functionality, and system performance.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES**

· Define and maintain test system configurations, maintain test data sets, write test plans and procedures ensuring traceability, and perform test executions.

· Communicate with development teams to harmonize the hand-off from development to systems test.

· Write automated test scripts and develop and execute aggressive and accurate schedules for assigned tasks and make adjustments as needed to maintain forward momentum.

· Research and resolve technical issues independently.

· Create test plans/scenarios/procedures that encompass numerous testing activities such as functional, non-functional, nominal, non-nominal, regression, security, performance, etc.

· Utilize enterprise tools for testing activities such as JIRA, LoadRunner, BrowserStack, Selenium, etc.

· Produce reports and documentation for all automated testing efforts, results, activities, data, logging, and tracking.

· Maintain regular and punctual attendance.

· Perform other duties as assigned.

**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS**

· Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret Security Clearance (U.S. Citizenship required).

· Bachelors’ degree (or the equivalent) Computer Science or an equivalent field with a minimum of six (6) years of relevant experience.

· Experience with Salesforce application or other CRM solutions.

· Must complete Salesforce Trailhead training after employment begins.

· Should have five (5) years of experience working in an integrated environment and multi-discipline collaboration (i.e., Systems Engineer, Software Developers, DevOps, etc.).

· Experience leading test teams is a plus.

· Experience developing mobile automated testing solutions.

· Experience with automated unit testing.

· Experience with continuous integration methodologies using tools like Jenkins and Bamboo.

· Experience with best practices in configuration management using tools like SVN.

· Experience with User Acceptance Testing.

· Experience with developing test plans, test cases and test scripts.

· Must obtain and maintain any necessary security access and/or background checks.

**DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS**

· Cloud environments such as AWS and Salesforce CRM a plus.

· Must have strong risk management skills and clearly communicate mitigation plans.

· Must have excellent communication experience required to interact with test teams and customers on a daily basis.

· Self-starter who is comfortable working both independently and with various skill sets including other integrators and testers.

· Organized and efficient with ability to document all levels of testing from unit to system testing.

· Experience in Microsoft Office tools (Outlook, Word, Excel, Visio, etc.).

**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES**

None.

Job Requirements

**WORK SCHEDULE**

Full-Time. May be required to work additional hours as needed to complete assignment or project.

**TRAVEL**

Travel up to 25% possible, but not anticipated.

**DRIVING REQUIREMENTS**

Must have or be able to attain a valid state driver’s license and be insurable on the company’s automobile insurance policy. Driving, with or without accommodation, may be required when traveling for training and/or short occasional amounts of local driving. The expected driving time is less than 25%.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT**

title: IT Systems Engineer
description:
Purpose
  
To expand, plan and maintain the IT-infrastructure, to design and implement new applications in the IT-environment and to resolve structural problems in order to ensure that the continuity and efficiency of the IT-infrastructure meets the needs of the organization and in order to guarantee its optimum availability and adherence to agreed service levels.
  
  

Areas of Responsibility / Tasks
  
Performance must reflect appropriate level of expertise and achievement of the desired results for the items listed below.
  
  

1. Offer second line support for incidents in order to restrict and prevent an interruption of the IT services.
  
2. Investigate the IT environment in a proactive and discerning way in order to make the necessary proposals for improvement in due time.
  
3. Install and update procedures and design configurations in order to offer the necessary tools to the first and second line to ensure the stability of the environment within the agreed service levels.
  
4. On a rotating basis, help ensuring a continuous service order to guarantee the agreed service levels.
  
5. Be responsible for technical realizations and take care of the necessary installations and configurations of the hard- and software in order to implement IT infrastructure in a successful way.
  
6. Conduct feasibility studies and assess different software and hardware solutions that meet the needs of the network/system/security infrastructure (SOE) to ensure that management can select the best possible solution.
  
7. Inform, train and guide 1st line support engineers to ensure that systems are used in the best possible manner and as efficiently as possible.
  
8. Stay well-informed about the evolutions within the specific field, keep his/her knowledge up-to-date within the context of new developments in order to strengthen his/her credibility by offering a service that is continuously based on updated knowledge.
  
9. All other duties as assigned
  
  

Supervisory Responsibilities
  
1. Not Applicable
  
  

Competencies; Knowledge, Skills, Abilities (KSA)
  
To perform this role successfully, an individual must have experience achieving desired result(s) in their areas of responsibility. The requirements listed below are representative of observable behaviors and essential knowledge, skill, and abilities required of a successful incumbent within our culture.
  
1. Strong communication skills, keen listener, professional verbal, and written skills.
  
2. Customer focused work approach
  
3. Strong ability to work in a team setting and also have the ability to perform as an individual contributor.
  
4. Ability to diagnose and resolve complex technical issues independently or by escalating as needed
  
5. Be proactive in training and seek out knowledge as needed to perform job responsibilities
  
6. Flexible. Able to cope with multiple/changing/competing priorities and deadlines with a high degree of optimism, professionalism, and collaboration.
  
7. Team attitude and always willing/motivated to assist others.
  
  

Minimum Qualifications/ Education / Experience / Certifications
  
  

**1. Education:**  

a. Bachelor's degree or related training equivalent - preferred
  
b. Minimum of 5 years of relevant work experience in similar title and scope of responsibility - preferred
  
  

**2. Systems Experience:**  

a. Windows Operating System and Microsoft Platform Tools is required (Mac OS is preferred)
  
b. Knowledge of mobile devices is required (iPhone, iPad, Android)
  
c. Familiar with various Web Based Conferencing / Communications applications – required (Teams, Zoom)
  
d. Microsoft Office Suite, Teams and SharePoint
  
  

**3. Licenses / Certifications:**  

a. Valid driver’s license – required
  
b. Related IT Certifications is plus
  
  

**4. Language:**  

a. Proficiency in English required, Dutch or local language (preferred)
  
  

**5. Cultural Experience:**  

a. Similar size organization – preferred
  
  

**NOTICE TO APPLICANTS:**  

Ravago Americas is an equal employment opportunity employer. We adhere to a policy of making employment decisions without regard to race, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, citizenship status, or marital status. We assure you that your opportunity for employment with this employer depends solely upon your qualifications.

title: CSM Engineer
description:
**Role Overview**

We're excited to welcome a proactive and hands-on Systems Engineer to our team, reporting to the Head of Customer Success. In this role, you will become a Cloud expert, advising our customers on integrating our technologies into their operational technology (OT) networks and ensuring their journey towards smart buildings is successful.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Engage with customers and partners through persuasive pre-sales presentations and demonstrations.
* Drive sales by participating in meetings and marketing activities.
* Lead technical aspects of sales, deployment, and upgrades.
* Guide customers on integrating Cloud into their existing systems.
* Serve as a technology expert, especially in software development, operating building ICN networks, and deploying edge applications at an enterprise scale.
* Develop comprehensive Statements of Work (SOWs), including technical architectures and deployment plans.
* Oversee customer installations, ensuring smooth pilot and production setups.
* Collaborate with internal teams (Technical Support, Marketing, Engineering, Product Development) to address technical issues and relay customer feedback.
* Contribute to the planning and maintenance of our Services/Solution lab and Managed Services offerings.
* Conduct product demos and training sessions.
* Develop scripts and automation tools for enhanced deployment and troubleshooting.

**Desired Skills and Experience**

* 3-5 years in a Pre-Sales Engineer, Systems Engineer, or Solutions Engineer role.
* Proficiency with Networking Protocols (TCP/IP), VLANs, and IP subnetting.
* Strong troubleshooting skills in IT and/or OT networks.
* Experience in Operational Technology (OT), particularly in commercial real estate, is a plus.
* Knowledge of Networking & IT technologies (Switching, Routing, Firewalls, VPN, Linux, Microsoft Active Directory).
* Familiarity with cloud and virtualization environments (VMware ESXi, AWS, Azure, GCP).
* Excellent communication and presentation skills.
* A team-oriented approach and willingness to support colleagues and other teams.
* Ability and willingness to travel up to 40% to customer sites.

**What We Offer:**

* An opportunity to be part of an innovative team revolutionizing the smart building industry.
* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* A supportive, inclusive, and collaborative work environment.
* Professional growth opportunities.

title: Sr. Splunk Engineer
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**

As a *Splunk IT Service Intelligence (ITSI) System Engineer*, you will support the design, deployment, implementation, and maintenance of the Splunk ITSI platform utilizing cyber engineering strategies, tools, and techniques to enhance the client’s cybersecurity posture. You will play a crucial role in ensuring the reliability, availability, and performance of our IT services to meet system and program requirements and goals.

If you are a self-motivated individual with a passion for this type of work, driving innovation and performance, and a desire to modernize and advance operational support and services, we want to hear from you. Apply Now!

**Job Duties:**

* Design, deploy, configure, and customize Splunk ITSI to meet monitoring and analytics needs.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
* Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and alerts.
* Monitor and troubleshoot infrastructure to ensure optimal performance and scalability.
* Implement and manage data inputs, including log files, metrics, and other data sources, to feed into Splunk ITSI.
* Develop and maintain automation scripts and integrations to streamline processes.
* Provide technical expertise and support to resolve issues and optimize configurations.
* Conduct performance tuning and capacity planning activities.
* Collaborate with security teams to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and best practices.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

**Education:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.

**Certification(s):**

* Preferred, but not mandatory:
* Splunk Core Certified

**Experience:**

* **experience with Slunk Enterprise, including writing Splunk queries in SPL.**
* **Required Experience:**
* Python.
* Linux OS, services, daemons, containers, and VMs.
* Splunk administration.
* SIEM tools or software.
* **Demonstrated experience and abilities:**
* Working in a highly collaborative environment with peers and senior government officials.
* Critical, analytical, and strategic thinking.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, to effectively communicate complex technical concepts and requirements, to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* **Desired experience/familiarity in/with:**
* Supporting the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS).

**Professional Attributes & Values:**

We are seeking someone who embodies the following professional attributes and values:

* Integrity and Accountability: Someone with a principled character and who consistently demonstrates honesty, integrity, and accountability in their work, and who takes responsibility for their actions and upholds high ethical standards.
* Respect and Diversity: Someone who sincerely treats others with dignity, civility, consideration, and fairness, and genuinely values how different perspectives and experiences have the ability to enhance and foster an inclusive work environment.
* Effective Communication: Someone who consistently conveys written and verbal information and communications professionally and in a timely manner and ensures accurate and comprehensive delivery with the first conveyance.
* Interpersonal Skills: Someone who projects a courteous and affable demeanor is essential for successful workplace interactions. We are looking for someone who possesses strong interpersonal skills, fostering positive relationships and promoting a collaborative atmosphere.
* Continuous Improvement: Someone who regularly, proactively, and honestly assesses their performance and skills, and pursues ways to grow and improve, whether via professional development, welcoming constructive feedback, introspection, engaging more, seeking direct or peripheral knowledge, etc
