title: Systems Engineer
description:
**The Systems Engineer – Identity and Access Management must be able to meet the key criteria below:**

1. **Location:** 100% remote

2. **Years’ Experience:** 4+ years

3. **Education:** Bachelors in Computer Science or IT related field

4. **Security Clearance:** IBR is a federal contractor. Applicants must be able to meet the requirements to obtain a Secret security clearance. NOTE: United States Citizenship is required for this type of security clearance.

5. **Work Authorization:** Must show that applicant is legally permitted to work in the United States

6. **Employment Type:** Full-Time, W-2

**7. Key Skills:**

· Experience performing requirements analysis and translating requirements into viable concept design solutions

· Experience writing user stories and acceptance criteria

· Experience maintaining design documents through traceability, updating procedures, analyzing system and program changes.

· Enterprise solution design experience

· Experience in release planning and execution

· Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) a bonus

· Experience with Identity and Access Management solution or willingness to learn

· Have or willingness to obtain an Okta certified professional certification

**8. Desired Skills**

· Experience with or desire to focus on Identity, Credential and Access Management (ICAM) solution components including one or more of the listed ICAM technologies listed below:

o Okta

o SailPoint

o Radiant Logic

o Ping

o CyberArk

o External Directory Services (Active Directory, LDAP)

o API Gateways

o F5

**Overview**

Do you want to help IBR build a portfolio of next-generation data collection systems and provide authentication and authorization services to those systems? As a Systems Engineer at IBR, you will contribute on the team that provides authentication and authorization solutions to enterprise web applications supporting %M users or more. You will work as a member of the ICAM development team on ICAM related capabilities design, development, and documentation.

Day to day responsibilities will include design and implementation of authentication and authorization related capabilities including analysis/design/development of ICAM tooling capabilities, ICAM architecture, backend web services, user interfaces, static web content, scripts, test procedures and technical documentation. You will lead release planning and execution or related tasks. You will either have an Okta Professional Certification and Security+ Certification or will be willing to attain them as you will be regularly using features in Okta (and other identity tools) to complete tasking. The ideal candidate will be extremely detail oriented. As part of our successful ICAM team you will work well with other team members and development leadership

**Responsibilities**

· Assist in requirements gathering, elicitation, and analysis in order to support concept architectures and system characteristics

· Review and analyze system requirements and identify impacts to the appropriate requirements and/or design specifications.

· Responsible for developing and managing subsystem and component level performance specifications by managing requirements

· Identify integration issues and system requirements discrepancies across multiple systems.

· Write Use Cases from high level concepts/requirements

· Creating software system process flow design/diagrams

· Improves system requirements process by studying current practices; designing and implementing improvements

· Development of static web content

· Design/Prototyping/Implementation of authentication and authorization capabilities within Okta and other ICAM related tools

· Ability to identify and/or perform analysis on ICAM related products and features

· Deploying and configuration ICAM related software products to virtual computing resources

· Okta integration with external directory services

· Usage of Atlassian Tools for day to day tasks within the Scrum process

· Use of Amazon Web Services (AWS) capabilities

· Reacting to change and communicating with others

**Qualifications**

· Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret security clearance

· 4+ years experience as a Software or Systems Engineer

· Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or IT related field

· Must have experience as a Systems Engineer specifically supporting systems engineering tasks such as:

o System design and development of documentation

o Provide expertise in business process modeling and requirements engineering

o Assessing current business processes and requirements

· Experience with eliciting, refining, and decomposition of requirements to provide a comprehensive set of requirements that meet the business customer needs.

· Experience with Requirements, Design, Implementation and/or Architecture

· Experience performing requirements analysis and translating requirements into viable concept design solutions

· Experience writing user stories and acceptance criteria

· Experience maintaining design documents through traceability, updating procedures, analyzing system and program changes.

· Experience preparing technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends

· Must have experience with Agile methodology and full Systems Development Lifecycle (SDLC)

· Experience with JIRA

· Excellent oral and written communication skills

· Enterprise solution design experience

· Software Engineering and User Interface design principle knowledge a bonus

· Experience in release planning and execution

· Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS)

· Desire to specialize in ICAM technologies and tools

· Experience with or desire to focus on Identity, Credential and Access Management (ICAM) solution components including one or more of the listed ICAM technologies listed below:

o Okta

o SailPoint

o Radiant Logic

o Ping

o CyberArk

o External Directory Services (Active Directory, LDAP)

o API Gateways

o F5

**Physical Demands**

Position consists of sitting for long periods of time, bending, stooping, crouching, and lifting up to 20 pounds. Frequently uses hands/fingers for manipulation of keyboard and mouse.

**Work Environment**

Work is performed primarily indoors at a well-lit office environment. The environment is normally air conditioned, but conditions may change dependent upon circumstances. Work may need to be performed in a fast-paced environment requiring quick thinking and rapid judgements. Employee will be exposed to a wide variety of clients in differing functions, personalities, and abilities.

**About IBR**  
Imagine Believe Realize, LLC (IBR) is an emerging small business focused on delivering software and systems engineering solutions to government and commercial clients. Our talent acquisition strategy is tailored to career seeking candidates who embrace continuous learning and desire to grow as a professional in the software/systems engineering industry. We strive to enhance our team members ability to thrive in the workplace by creating a proper work/life balance and first-class benefits package that includes:

· Nationwide medical, dental, and vision insurance

· 3 weeks of Paid Time Off and 11 Paid Federal Holidays

· 401k matching

· Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, and Long-Term Disability at no cost to our employees

· Flexible spending accounts and Dependent Care spending accounts

· Wellness incentives

· Reimbursement for professional development and certifications

· Training assistance opportunities

Upon hire and in compliance with federal law, all persons hired are required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States, and to complete the required employment eligibility verification and background check. IBR is a Federal Contractor.

Imagine Believe Realize, LLC is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, age, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.”  
Learn more at http://www.teamibr.com

If alternative methods of assistance are needed with the application process, additional contact information has been provided below:

info@teamibr.com

title: Operations Engineer
description:
Axos Bank
Target Range:
$100,000.00 - $120,000.00
Actual starting pay will vary based on factors including, but not limited to, geographic location, experience, skills, specialty, and education.
Eligible for an Annual Discretionary Cash Bonus Target: 10%
Eligible for an Annual Discretionary Restricted Stock Units Bonus Target: 10%*These discretionary target bonuses may be awarded semi-annually based upon your achievement of performance goals and targets.*
About This Job
As our Operations Engineer, you will join our Center of Excellence team which is at the heart of Axos' internal systems interfacing with various leaders in this high-profile role. You will work with technical and business teams to understand the business requirements, functional, and technical specifications for Actimize and other data integrations to design, code, and maintain new and existing complex SQL stored procedures and functions. You would be responsible for monitoring/maintaining EDW production environments. The ideal experience will be 3+ years' working with relational Databases in a production environment. This position can sit 100% remote, depending upon your location.
Responsibilities* Work with technical and business team to understand the business requirements, functional and technical specifications
* Design, code and maintain new and existing complex SQL stored procedures and functions
* Performance tune existing stored procedures, tables and indexes
* Work with other engineers to troubleshoot, repair and performance tune databases
* Review SQL code written by other developers to ensure compliance to coding standards and best practices as well as maximum performance
* Create SSIS packages for data transformation, cleansing, caching, aggregation, staging, and transfer
* Troubleshoot problems that may come up with database environments: performance issues; replication issues; or operational issues
* Perform data analysis and data profiling tasks to provide support and recommendations for development and design decisions
* Analyze and define data flow requirements and prepare applicable system documentation and operation manuals as needed
* Support production data loads and ongoing refreshes of the database systems
* Define, prepare, execute and implement data validation and unit testing methods to ensure data quality
* Maintain re-usable development standards that help implement each solution and/or enhancements to existing systems to meet current and future needs
* Monitor, troubleshoot and resolve production issues or requests
* Perform enhancements and bug fixes as required
* Provide Support for Actimize application availability, latency, scalability and efficiency
* Provide support for regression testing/ other needed validations for Actimize application upgrades
* Perform any additional duties as assigned


Requirements* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Computer Engineering or related field
* 3+ years' working with relational DBs in a production environment
* 3+ years' experience with Microsoft SQL Server
* 2+ years' experience in SSIS packages
* 2+ years' experience working in an Agile/SCRUM environment
* 1+ year's experience with NICE Actimize application
* 1+ year's Python/ C# scripting experience
* Working knowledge of compliance, financial crimes law, Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Bank Secrecy Act (BSA)


Axos Employee Benefits May Include:* Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
* Paid Sick Leave, 3 weeks’ Vacation, and Holidays (about 11 a year)
* HSA or FSA account and other voluntary benefits
* 401(k) Retirement Saving Plan with Employer Match Program and 529 Savings Plan
* Employee Mortgage Loan Program and free access to an Axos Bank Account with Self-Directed Trading

About Axos
Born digital-first, Axos delivers financial tools and services that allow individuals, small businesses, and companies to access and manage their money how, when, and where they want. We’re a diverse team of dynamic, insightful, and independent innovators who are excited to provide technology-driven solutions that offer unbeatable value to our customers.
Axos Financial is our holding company and is publicly traded on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol "AX" (NYSE: AX).
Learn more about working at Axos
Pre-Employment Drug Test:
All offers are contingent upon the candidate successfully passing a credit check, criminal background check, and pre-employment drug screening, which includes screening for marijuana. Axos Bank is a federally regulated banking institution. At the federal level, marijuana is an illegal schedule 1 drug; therefore, we will not employ any person who tests positive for marijuana, regardless of state legalization.
Equal Employment Opportunity:
Axos Bank is an Equal Opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, religious creed, color, sex (including pregnancy, breast feeding and related medical conditions), gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, military and veteran status, marital status, age, protected medical condition, genetic information, physical disability, mental disability, or any other protected status in accordance with all applicable federal, state, and local laws.
Job Functions and Work Environment:
While performing the duties of this position, the employee is required to sit for extended periods of time. Manual dexterity and coordination are required while operating standard office equipment such as computer keyboard and mouse, calculator, telephone, copiers, etc.
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee may encounter while performing the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position.

title: Linux Systems Administrator
description:
**WHAT WE WANT**

FriendFinder Networks is looking for a Linux Systems Administrator who will be responsible for availability, installation, configuration, provisioning, operation, and maintenance of systems hardware and software. You will respond to trouble tickets created by the NOC, monitor automations and internal customers; install new servers, rebuild existing servers, and configure hardware, peripherals, services, and settings in accordance with operational requirements. You have to document, update and maintain installation and configuration procedures on the Wiki, and will contribute and maintain best practices documentation for operations, security, and capital efficiency. Your contributions will ensure our systems will provide our customers the best possible user experience for everyone who visits our web sites 24 hours a day, every day of the year, all over the world.

**WHAT YOU WILL DO**

* Ensure proper security, monitoring, alerting and reporting for the infrastructure
* Work with the NOC and DC Tech teams, using Tivoli monitoring and other tools to ensure the integrity and availability of our hardware, server resources, reviewing system and application logs, and verifying completion of scheduled jobs such as backups
* Work with the incident team to diagnose and recover from hardware or software failures working with or as the Incident Commander to coordinate and communicate with our internal customers
* Assist project teams with technical issues in the planning phase of sites or project development efforts
* Gather system requirements and support several project teams in evolving, testing and rolling-out new products and services, then transitioning the site or product to post launch operations activities throughout life of the product or service
* Work with the R&D team and other systems engineers to make improvements
* Document processes and procedures and follow a formal change management procedure

**WHAT YOU MUST HAVE**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science and/or equivalent work experience
* 5+ years’ experience administering Linux required or equivalent work experience
* Experience with Apache, nginx, lighttpd, and high volume web servers
* Experience with high volume mail servers
* Experience with monitoring tools, e.g. nagios, cacti
* Experience with kickstart or jumpstart maintenance and implementation
* Experience with load balancers
* Experience in analysis and system performance tuning
* Experience in Perl or Shell Scripting, with experience implementing automation and monitoring using shell scripting and other related tools
* Experience with proxies / reverse proxies, e.g. ha-proxy, squid, varnish
* You must be comfortable with adult content
* You must be at least 21 years old

**WHAT IS PREFERABLE TO HAVE**

* Knowledge of protocols such as DNS, HTTP, SMTP, SNMP
* Knowledge of OSI model
* Knowledge of the challenges in a very large multifaceted global environment
* Comfortable with new technologies such as containers/Docker and container orchestration such as Kubernetes
* Ability to implement automation and monitoring using shell scripting and other related tools, Puppet

**WHAT YOU SHOULD BE ABLE TO DEMONSTRATE**

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Critical thinking skills in a complex IT environment to analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve problems without direction
* Outstanding organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines
* High degree of honesty and integrity
* Team-player, positive attitude and flexible

**REPORTING TO THIS POSITION:** No direct reports

**PERKS**

FriendFinder Networks Inc. and its subsidiaries offer a business casual work environment, flexible work hours, and a competitive salary. The benefits package includes:

* 401(k) with a 6% match on eligible earnings with no vesting period
* Medical (Kaiser HMO, Blue Cross PPO), Dental, and Vision
* Flexible Spending Account for Healthcare and Dependent Care
* Life Insurance, AD&D, LTD and Short and Long Term Disability
* Paid Time Off (20 days PTO) and Holiday Pay (12 company paid holidays off)
* Employee Assistance Program
* Commuter Benefits
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Health Club Reimbursement

**WE ARE PASSIONATE ABOUT WHAT WE DO**

Not only do we love what we do, but we truly believe in it. We grow through positive education, skill training, courses, big stories, and big dreams. We are constantly improving and striving for perfection to revolutionize and enhance the lives of our members.

**WE CARE ABOUT PEOPLE**

The main precondition of any relationship is the ability to put ourselves in someone else’s shoes to truly understand them. Satisfied customers, employees, and business partners are not just a cog in the wheel, but the main ingredient of the company’s success.

**WE EMBRACE DIVERSITY IN ALL FORMS**

FriendFinder Networks has embraced diversity from the beginning of its history dating back to the mid 1990s. We created the first online personals sites for gays and lesbians, for non-English-speaking audiences, and for those who enjoy what was once called "alternative lifestyles". Headquartered in San Francisco / Silicon Valley and staffed throughout the world, our team also relies on diversity of background, perspectives, and ideas.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Health Information Systems Engineer, Strategic Information Systems
description:
**Position Title:** Health Information Systems Engineer, Strategic Information Systems
**Reports To**: Lead Software Developer
**Location**: Employees in this role can work from our Boston, MA office, remotely within the U.S. or hybrid of these two options. Up to 10% international travel
**Position Type**: Full-time **Position Overview**  

The Health Information Systems (HIS) Engineer, Strategic Information Systems (Systems Engineer) is responsible for supporting, implementing and configuring cloud-hosted and locally deployed health information systems utilized across the health facilities Partners In Health (PIH) supports worldwide. Working as a key member within a small team of global health information systems specialists, the Systems Engineer will collaborate closely with informatics, monitoring and evaluation, quality improvement, supply chain, laboratory, radiology, and other clinical & operations departments globally on maintaining critical systems in support of patient care, operational efficiencies, and continuous improvement. This person will support the development of best practices for administering our systems, and work with our implementation teams at our health care facilities to execute them. The Systems Engineer must have a strong and demonstrated technical aptitude and a passion for health equity.

  

**Primary Responsibilities**  

*End-User* *Support and Capacity B**uilding (35%)*
* Collaborate with site-based HIS and IT managers for identification and resolution of technical support issues, including both software and hardware-related issues.
* Proactively monitor deployed systems for potential issues.
* Directly train and work with care delivery site counterparts to increase overall capacity to perform system support.
* Develop documentation, including training materials and support manuals, to facilitate local resolution of issues.
* Facilitate issue notification and resolution with vendor support teams for health information systems.

*System Implementation and* *Configuration* *(**2**5%)*
* Configure information systems, including OpenMRS, in the cloud and locally for use at our health care facilities.
* Develop and implement automated tools for repeatable provisioning of applications, configuration and content into development, test, and production environments.
* Configure and integrate disparate health information platforms within a Health Information Exchange including for Data Warehousing, Data Collection, Lab, Radiology, Pharmacy and other systems.

  

*Server Administration, Security, and O**perations (25%)*
* Provision and update servers in both cloud and on-premises deployments.
* Configure, document, and maintain back-end services including user accounts, backups, monitoring, network configuration, SSL certificates, security rules, and package upgrades.
* Administer and maintain productivity and collaboration tools (e.g., JIRA, Bamboo).
* Develop tools to facilitate the consistent and reliable provisioning of servers and applications, leveraging industry best practices (e.g., Ansible, Puppet, Docker).

  

*Field-based Collaboration, Support* *(15%)*
* Travel periodically to PIH care delivery sites for bi-directional training, learning and collaboration on cross-site support improvement.
* Perform site assessments and support planning for infrastructure and process changes in support of HIS implementation.
* In-person and virtual support of rollout of new implementations, including training, support, and maintenance.

  

**Qualifications**  

* A Bachelor's or Master’s degree in computer science or a related field, along with a minimum of two years of relevant work experience.
* Alternatively, in place of a degree, a proven track record of 4 to 8 years of experience working as a Systems Engineer or in a related role.
* Mastery of Linux system administration (particularly Ubuntu) and Bash shell
* Experience with DevOps tooling such as Docker, Ansible, and Puppet strongly preferred
* Strong understanding of core programming principles
* Familiarity with Windows system administration a plus
* Experience with SQL strongly preferred
* Experience with any of the following domains a plus:


o OpenMRS, DHIS2, CommCare, or other open source HIS solutions
o HIS Interoperability standards including HL7 and FHIR
o Open-source development and collaboration with widely distributed teams
* Experience collaborating with local and remote teams in an agile development environment (i.e., tracking work in tickets, using source control tools such as git, performing code reviews, etc.)
* Ability to take initiative, work independently and with minimal direction
* Interest in public health, international development, and social justice strongly desired
* Strong communication and organizational skills
* Fluency in English is required; proficiency in French, Haitian Kreyol, or Spanish desirable

  

**Organizational Profile**  

Partners In Health (PIH) is a non-profit, global health organization that fights social injustice by bringing the benefits of modern medical science first and foremost to the most vulnerable communities around the world. PIH focuses on those who would not otherwise have access to quality health care. PIH partners with the world’s leading academic institutions to create rigorous evidence that shapes more sound and all-inclusive global health policies. PIH also supports local governments’ efforts to build capacity and strengthen national health systems.  

As of today, PIH runs programs in 11 countries (Haiti, Kazakhstan, Lesotho, Liberia, Malawi, Mexico, Navajo Nation, Peru, Rwanda, Sierra Leone, United States), where it provides direct care to millions of patients, through public facilities and community engagement.  

Partners In Health (PIH) is committed to the fundamental principle of equal opportunity and equal treatment for every prospective and current employee. It is the policy of PIH not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, age, religion, creed, disability, sex and gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state or local law. PIH works in and with a number of governments in and outside the U.S., and to the extent applicable, this statement is intended to incorporate the prohibition of any unlawful discrimination covered by applicable laws in such countries, states and municipalities.  

Partners In Health participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, this employer is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before the employer can take any action against you, including terminating your employment. Employers can only use E-Verify once you have accepted a job offer and completed the Form I-9. **Pay and Benefits**


The pay range for this position at commencement of employment is expected to be between $70,000.00 and $90,000.00/year. The starting salary offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market for the position, job-related knowledge, skills and experience.


Subject to the terms and conditions of the applicable plans then in effect, eligible employees may enroll in a 401(k) plan with employer match, as well as participate in organization-sponsored medical, dental, vision, short-term and long-term disability insurance, and basic life insurance plans for the employee and the employee’s eligible dependents. Full time employees will receive 15 days of vacation, 12 sick days, 3 personal days, and 3 volunteer days in addition to paid time off during the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day, the week of July 4th, and 11 additional holidays annually.

title: VMWare Infrastructure Engineer II
description:
**Company Description**  

Improving healthcare through innovative technology is at the core of Intelerad’s work. Our scalable medical imaging platform connects clinicians to a powerful imaging ecosystem that is fast, smart, and tapped into the data they need, no matter their location. We’re focused on delivering a best-in-class medical image management solution that improves provider efficiency, decreases the cost of healthcare, and improves the overall health of populations.


We pride ourselves in identifying talented, driven professionals who are ready to hit the ground running with creative problem-solving skills and an innovative mindset. Our culture demands Grit, Humility, Integrity, Results Orientation, a Winning Attitude, and a strong Drive to Excellence.

  

Headquartered in Raleigh, NC and Montreal, Intelerad has nearly 800 employees located in offices across six countries. The company empowers nearly 2,000 healthcare organizations around the world with the speed, scalability, and simplicity needed to increase business performance while, most importantly, improving patient outcomes. Intelerad’s modern enterprise solutions have been acknowledged by a Best in KLAS recognition, ranking #1 for PACS Asia/Oceania in the 2021 Best in KLAS: Global Software (Non-US) report.

 **Job Description**  

Are you an infrastructure and systems engineer passionate about maximizing application performance and resiliency?

* Do you have experience maintaining, configuring and optimizing VMware deployments and associated infrastructure technologies (storage, networking, etc)?
* Are you passionate about standardization and automation?
* Do you want to be part of a journey as we launch new data centers in numerous global regions?


Then the SRE - VMWare Infrastructure Engineer role with Intelerad is for you!! We are seeking an energetic Infrastructure Engineer with experience deploying, optimizing and fortifying VMWare deployments and associated systems (storage, networking, etc). As an Infrastructure Engineer you will be viewed as a senior expert working on our data centers running a fleet of VMWare machines across Microsoft Windows and Linux operating systems. You will participate in and at times lead efforts to configure and support our systems stack including but not limited to: configuring hosts; configuring storage; updating hosts, VMs, tools; troubleshooting hardware failures; streamlining application performance via optimizing VMWare, network and storage configurations. All of this and being able to participate in our high-growth journey as we launch brand new data centers across the globe as well as in AWS!!


As an Infrastructure Engineer II you will be a critical member of our team. Acting as an escalation for our tier one engineers and also participating in designing and maintaining our overall infrastructure solution. You will be in charge of designing and implementing improvement projects, to drive continuous improvement

* Manage and maintain vmware environment
* Configure storage systems
* Collaborate in the creation of systems architectures,
* Mentoring of junior engineers to help develop their technical skills
* Improve application performance and reliability
* Lead troubleshooting efforts create incident reports and root cause analysis
* Perform schedule tasks such as daily checklists and in on-call rotation

 **Qualifications**  

Soft skills are just as important to us as technical knowledge is. We prioritize progression, grit, and solutions-oriented thinking styles:

* Drive to learn new technologies and try something new
* Team player that embraces positive conflict
* Experience deploying upgrading and maintaining of multiple VMWare Environments
* Experience implementing and operating various Storage Technologies in a highly availability, high performance, low latency configuration (e.g. FC SAN, NFS NAS)
* Experience with implementation and testing of Backup, DR, and Business Continuity technology in a high durability environment )
* Attention to detail
* Ability to independently manage priorities in a fast-paced environment


Desired Experience/Skills:

* Vmware management and support
* Dell Poweredge experience
* UCS Compute experience
* Experience with Ideally Nimble, Pure, PowerScale and Qumulo as storage technologies
* Experience with hosting applications in AWS

 **Additional Information**  

Intelerad is committed to the principles of equal employment. We are committed to complying with all federal, state and local laws providing equal employment opportunities and all other employment laws and regulations. Applicants, employees and former employees are protected from employment discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, or gender identity), national origin, age (40 or older), disability and genetic information (including family medical history). Intelerad is dedicated to the fulfillment of this policy regarding all aspects of employment, including but not limited to recruiting, hiring, placement, transfer, training, promotion, rates of pay, and other compensation, termination, and all other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment.

 **Additional Information**

* Competitive salaries
* Employee recognition program
* Employee referral program
* Flexible hours
* Comprehensive insurance plan
* Training & skills upgrading
* Social events
* Dynamic culture

title: Aruba Wireless Engineer
description:
My name is Muralidharan and I’m working with Cloud Destinations LLC as a Technical Recruiter.

Below are the job details as needed by the hiring manager. Kindly advise if you might be interested and qualified for the below opportunity and if we can discuss further on this

**Position: L3 Aruba Wireless Engineer**

**Duration: 5-6 months Contract**

**Location: Remote, (with some travel)**

**Description:**

This role will be for an L3 Remote based, US resource. There will be required travel for surveys, etc. The role will be 30-40 hours weekly variable based on workload (expect more in the 35-40 hour range)  
**Overview**:

* The Senior Wireless Network Engineer must be a detail oriented, committed problem solver with robust communication skills who will execute the vision through the design and oversight of a web and mobile application platform.
* Responsible for setup and installation of technical systems, applications, or process designs for client’s purchased or outsourced technology and business process solutions. Works directly with client to manage initial access, map and transfer data, create process documentation, and train or coordinate training for client users.
* Tests and troubleshoots functionality of installed systems; identifies and documents technical issues to be escalated to product and system integration teams for resolution. Provides feedback based on client experiences to product and professional services teams for product and process improvements.
* Experience working for a Global multi-national corporation.
* MUST have Highly skilled with performing on-site Wireless survey s for AP placement. Must have strong experience with Aruba Wireless and Ekahau Sidekick 2 survey tools

**Required Experience:**

* Must have 8-10 years of experience in specification, design, development, and deployment of digital wireless networks and communication systems inclusive of :
* Wireless Pre-Design Site Visit, Wireless Predictive Design, Wireless Post Installation Survey, & APoS Surveys.
* Knowledge of 802.11 standards, CAPWAP, Cisco WLC; be able to use tools such as Cisco Prime Infrastructure, AirMagnet Spectrum, Ekahau Pro, or other Survey and RF tools, to design and support WLANS.
* Interact with clients on site to meet complex requirements of a solution.
* Escalate unresolved problems and issues to the relevant third parties.
* Respond to escalated client requests and support client applications to a first line resolution.
* Escalate complex problems to the relevant third parties.
* Write reports and proposals and complete and maintain project documentation.
* Assist with the documentation of standard operating procedures relating to installations and fixes.
* Expert understanding of Aruba Wireless Network architecture, design, configuration, and operations is required.
* Extensive practical knowledge of switching and routing protocols (OSPF, BGP, and EIGRP).
* Solid understanding of general Network and Security fundamentals.
* Remotely supporting clients within service level agreements (SLAs),
* Install and Configure software and hardware as well as resolve incidents,
* Perform root cause analysis and adhere to any related processes such as change management.
* Device and network performance analysis and troubleshooting skills
* Strong oral and written communication skills.
* Ability to lead technical discussions (internally and externally with vendors).
* Demonstrated technical success in a fast paced, results-oriented engineering environment.
* Ability to work independently, and mentor others.
* Possessing active certifications like: HPE Aruba Certifications, CCIE Wireless, Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) Wireless or Certified Wireless Network Professional (CWNP), is a strong plus.

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $70.00 - $75.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Aruba Wireless: 4 years (Required)
* Wireless Networking: 10 years (Required)
* Ekahau: 1 year (Required)

* Certified Wireless Network Professional (Required)

title: GMS Applications Engineer – Market- #298
description:
* **~2 Year Contract- Possible Extensions**
* **W2 Employee Only- NO CORP to CORP**
* **Candidate can work 100% remote from the U.S., however Texas Residency is preferred, due to monthly onsite team meetings**
* **Starting range $65+/hr (Depends on engineer experience level mentioned in job description)**

﻿

**JOB DESCRIPTION:** 

ERCOT offers the flexibility to work both in and out of the office within the state of Texas, providing our employees with an enhanced work life balance.

**JOB SUMMARY**

Provides support for Market Management Systems (MMS) applications portfolio such as Security Constrained Economic Dispatch (SCED), Day-Ahead Market (DAM), Reliability Unit Commitment (RUC), Congestion Revenue Rights (CRR), QSE Training Simulator etc. Actively involved in the design, development, testing, validation and implementation of modifications and enhancements to MMS applications. This position will report to the Manager of Grid & Market Solutions (GMS) Applications Engineering - Markets.

**JOB DUTIES**

* Understands and applies principles, theories and concepts related to the profession and ERCOT's culture.
* Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action.
* Impact is generally limited to specific assignments or projects.
* May respond to inquiries and provide guidance to lower-level workers.

**ADDITIONAL JOB DUTIES**

* Serves as the technical Subject Matter Expert for the department
* Serves as a Technical Lead for Market Management System (MMS) portfolio projects and drives the implementation from incubation to go-live.
* Makes independent decisions except in instances of unusually complex application scenarios
* Works on the most complex application issues where analysis of situations requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors
* Works with database administrators and infrastructure teams on complex MMS application issues triggered from server/network/storage/database components
* Tests Non-Functional requirements of MMS application changes and coordinates with database/infrastructure teams to performs the tests
* Member of the 24/7 Market Applications Engineering support on call team and supports, troubleshoot market applications and system on call issues.
* Coordinate application set up and testing with QSEs, LSEs, REs as appropriate.
* Performs MMS model load testing on periodic basis and updates the model data in real-time based on established procedures.
* Design and Test MMS Interfaces and Web & Client/Server applications changes.
* Verify and support MMS applications during system site failovers, server/system/database upgrades and patching
* Fosters and leverages strong working relationships with other internal departments
* Lends professional expertise to guide projects and help teammates assigned by manager
* Demonstrates skills as an expert user of power system software applications and tools, spreadsheet programs, and database programs
* Maintains knowledge of emerging trends and industry best practices
* Performs all work according to applicable rules and regulations including regulatory requirements and organization policies and procedures.

**REQUIRED EXPERIENCE**

Level II:

* Requires minimum 2 years related work experience in excess of degree requirements

Level III:

* Requires minimum 3 years related work experience in excess of degree requirements

Senior Level:

* Requires minimum 5 years related work experience in excess of degree requirements

Lead Level Engineer Requirements:

* Requires minimum 8 years related work experience in excess of degree requirements
* 5 years minimum experience with generation application, Automatic Generation Control (AGC)
* Understanding of Generation Control Concepts

**EDUCATION**

* Bachelor's Degree : Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related field (Required)
* Master's Degree : Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related field (Preferred)
* or a combination of education and experience that provides equivalent knowledge to a major in such fields is required

**Work Location:** 

* The majority of job duties can be performed remotely from your Texas residence.
* May be required to be on-site at the Taylor facilities at least once a week, or more based on the business needs and as determined by the Manager
* May select a hybrid work schedule of set days to work remote and on-site or choose to work on-site 100% of the time

title: Network Engineer
description:
At Diversified, we don't just follow tech trends - we set them by leveraging the best in technology and ongoing advisory services to transform businesses. Our comprehensive suite of solutions is engineered to help our clients build connections that make a difference – whether by inspiring viewers, engaging associates, motivating audiences, or streamlining and safeguarding operations.
  
Our dedicated teams craft solutions experienced by millions every day including:
  
* Delivering the fan experience at one of 100+ sports facilities for the NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, MLS, NCAA
* Building the first fly pack broadcast system transportable by air - bringing the 2022 World Cup and Super Bowl into homes across the world
* Engineering the first high-density pixel canvas to display HD content at that scale for the Vornado, Marriott Marquis LED Display in Times Square, NY
* Empowering and monitoring communication and collaboration solutions within multi-national companies around the globe


Founded in 1993, we’re a global organization serving local needs with associates worldwide. Learn more at onediversified.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.
  
  

What part will you play?
  
We are seeking a highly skilled Network Engineer with a strong background in network infrastructure design, implementation, and maintenance, along with proficiency in integrating audio-visual solutions into network environments. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of networking principles, protocols, and technologies, as well as hands-on experience in deploying and managing audio-visual systems within complex network architectures.
  
  

What will you be doing?
  
* Design, deploy, and maintain robust network infrastructure solutions, including routers, switches, firewalls, and other networking components, to ensure optimal performance, reliability, and security.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to assess, plan, and implement audio-visual solutions that meet the organization's needs, integrating AV equipment with existing network infrastructure.
* Configure and troubleshoot audio-visual devices, such as projectors, displays, video conferencing systems, and audio equipment, to ensure seamless operation and compatibility with the network.
* Develop and implement network policies, procedures, and best practices to optimize audio-visual performance, minimize latency, and ensure quality of service (QoS) for multimedia traffic.
* Conduct network capacity planning and performance monitoring to identify potential bottlenecks, optimize resource utilization, and proactively address network issues.
* Collaborate with vendors and third-party service providers to evaluate new audio-visual technologies, products, and services, and make recommendations for their adoption based on business requirements and technical feasibility.
* Provide technical leadership and mentorship to junior network engineers, sharing knowledge and best practices related to audio-visual integration and network management.
* Stay up-to-date with emerging networking and audio-visual technologies, standards, and trends, and assess their potential impact on the organization's infrastructure and operations.
* Participate in project planning and execution, including requirements gathering, solution design, implementation, testing, and documentation, ensuring alignment with business objectives and timelines.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define and prioritize requirements for audio-visual solutions, ensuring alignment with business goals and user needs.


What do we require from you?
  
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field; or equivalent work experience.
* Minimum of 3 years of experience in network engineering, with a focus on designing, deploying, and managing enterprise-level networks.
* Strong understanding of networking principles and protocols, including TCP/IP, VLANs, OSPF, BGP, MPLS, QoS, and multicast.
* Hands-on experience with network equipment from vendors such as Cisco, Juniper, Aruba, and Palo Alto Networks, including routers, switches, firewalls, and VPNs.
* Proficiency in integrating audio-visual solutions into network environments, with experience configuring and troubleshooting AV devices and protocols (e.g., HDMI, HDCP, HDBaseT, Dante).
* Familiarity with audio-visual standards and technologies, such as H.264, H.265, SIP, WebRTC, Dante, AES67, and SDVoE.
* Experience with video conferencing systems (e.g., Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Cisco Webex) and collaboration tools, including setup, configuration, and troubleshooting.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify, diagnose, and resolve complex network and AV issues in a timely manner.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and vendors.
* Industry certifications such as CCNP, CCIE, CompTIA Network+, AVIXA CTS, or equivalent are a plus.


**Preferred Qualifications of the Network Engineer:**  

* It will be good to have an understanding of the following technologies:
* AMP
* SSL
* TACAS+
* MPLS
* WAAS
* DMVPN
* Palo Alto
* F5 Load Balancer
* Practical use of scripting languages
* SDN
* AAA
* NAT
* VPN
* EIGRP
* OSPF


**Note:** This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of the position and is not an exhaustive list of skills, efforts, duties, responsibilities, or working conditions associated with it. Management reserves the right to modify duties or assign additional duties as needed.
  
  

To learn more about becoming part of the Diversified team, visit us at http://diversifiedus.com/about/careers/ or email us at careers@onediversified.com.
  
  

Diversified is an equal employment opportunity employer and all aspects of employment will be based on job requirements, individual qualifications, merit, performance and business needs. We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, age, disability or genetic information, or any other applicable characteristic protected under federal, state or local law. We celebrate diversity and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply for available positions. Individuals needing assistance or an accommodation to complete an application due to a disability, may contact Human Resources at careers@onediversified.com.

title: Industrial & Systems Engineer I - Remote
description:
McLane, a wholly owned unit of Berkshire Hathaway Inc, is one of the largest supply chain services leaders in the United States, providing grocery and foodservice solutions for convenience stores, mass merchants, drug stores and chain restaurants. Through McLane Grocery and McLane Foodservice, McLane operates over 80 distribution centers.
  

  

An Industrial Engineer I will support various initiatives and network wide projects for the McLane Grocery distribution centers, typically related to cost reduction and productivity improvements. The engineer will be responsible implement and support capital and process improvement initiatives within the facility, region or network and will support DC Operations as needed. An Engineer may additionally perform operational and transportation analysis, continuous process improvements, engineered labor standards (ELS) updates, warehouse management system configuration as well as facility and capacity planning.  

Successful candidates will be natural self-starters with an ability to communicate and interact with multiple cross-functional levels of the organization.  

  

**COMPENSATION:**  

* $72,000 to $82,000 base salary (commensurate with experience), plus 10% bonus potential

  

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS / PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:**  

Other duties may be assigned. A teammate in this position must have the ability to:  

* Support multiple divisions operations and special projects.
* Align Standard Operating Procedures with Corporate Engineering.
* Partner with division operations to reinforce consistent process execution and identify opportunities for process improvement.
* Assess and optimize processes and equipment within the facility and region to support business needs.
* Implement and support McLane's warehouse, labor, execution and slotting optimization systems.
* Perform adhoc data analysis on key business functions.
* Develop efficient layouts, workstations, and material handling systems for new and existing facilities.

  

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS:**  

* Bachelor's degree in Industrial Engineering preferred, other applicable degrees with accompanying experience will be considered.
* Experience with Manhattan WMOS and LMS or JDA/Red Prairie WMS and LMS (preferred).
* Experience within distribution facility layout, racking layout and design (preferred).
* Understanding of distribution center operations to include receiving, selection, replenishment, routing and dispatch.
* Possess excellent oral and written communication skills with ability to advocate for and present recommendations to senior leadership.
* Be able to function in a fast-paced office and warehouse environment in a professional manner.
* Strong Knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, and Project.
* Understanding of Statistical Analysis and Operations Research a plus.

  

**WORKING CONDITIONS:**  

* Office and Warehouse environment.
* This position is expected to travel up to 75%.

  

Candidates may be subject to a background check and drug screen, in accordance with applicable laws.  

  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: Quality Systems Engineer- REMOTE
description:
Hydro Extrusions is a world-leading aluminium extrusion business counting around 100 production sites in 40 countries and employing 20,000 people. Through our unique combination of local expertise, global network, and unmatched R&D capabilities, we can offer everything from standards profiles, to advanced development and manufacturing for most industries. Since 1905, Hydro has turned natural resources into valuable products for people and businesses with focus on a safe and good workplace for our 30,000 employees in more than 140 locations.


Hydro is committed to leading the way in shaping a sustainable future and in doing so, creating more viable societies by developing natural resources into products and solutions in innovative and efficient ways to industries that matter.

**Job Location:** REMOTE (US)

 **Hydro employees can enjoy several benefits including:**

* Medical, Rx, Dental, Disability, Life Insurance, Flexible Spending Accounts
* Retirement Savings Plans with Company Match/Contributions
* Education Assistance
* Bonus Plan Eligibility
* Parental Leave

**Job Summary****:** The primary purpose of this position is to apply intensive and diversified knowledge of Quality Management principles and practices in broad areas of assignment with a focus on engineering solutions for continued improvement and development of the Management System. The role of the ENA Quality Systems Engineer is the implementation, maintenance, and improvement of best practices for quality processes and systems, working alongside local resources at the plants. The MS team takes a risk-based approach and works with area leaders and personnel to streamline processes, standards, and practices into a best-in-class status. Directly reports to ENA Senior Manager, Quality Systems.

 **Salary Range:**$75,300- $85,000

 **Education and Work Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in an engineering discipline is preferred. Equivalent experience will be considered.

 **Job Responsibilities:**

* Provide training and champion the network to management system excellence including conformity to ISO 9001, IATF 16949, Customer Specific Requirements (CSR), ASI, and ENA policies.
* Organize, manage, lead, and undertake audits across all areas of the business as well as across the supply chain, including system, and product audits utilizing a risk-based approach.
* Develop innovative and practical solutions to complex and unique process problems using best practices, innovation, and creativity. Lead/support through implementation.
* Work closely with all levels of plant personnel to understand current state and develop engineered solutions to address nonconformities and drive improvement.
* Provide QMS support throughout the organization and assist with management and execution of CAPA’s, NC’s, and SCAR’s.
* Study all ENA sites and the competitive landscape to understand the best methods (true north ultimate target) of performing key tasks within all operations with a focus on process performance and enabling improved efficiencies.
* Liaise and communicate with other departments, customers, suppliers, and other service suppliers.
* Leads / Supports significant Quality System projects effectively using a working knowledge of project management techniques.
* Ability to engineer systemic solutions to organizational challenges. While auditing is an important part of the role, the preferred candidate will be able to work collaboratively to solve systemic issues and not simply leave lists for stakeholders to complete on their own.
* Perform other duties, as needed, and as directed by your line of supervision.

**Job Requirements:**

* Demonstrated high standard for excellence and core belief in quality compliance. Strong commitment to developing a culture of safety and quality ethics and compliance at all levels of the organization. Shows care, courage and collaboration with openness and honesty in all dealings.
* Support a culture of quality and continuous improvement throughout the organization to ensure achievement of Quality KPI’s and goals.
* Demonstrated proficiency in coaching, teaching and generally developing employees in needed skill sets that contribute to their personal betterment and to the betterment of the company.
* Ability to define work processes and lead team members in successful implementation and ongoing execution utilizing a collaborative approach to working with others and engaging interest.
* Been part of a cultural change within an organization and have vision for true north based improvement (Preferred).
* Well-developed written and oral communication skills to ensure clear and professional communications to all levels of the organization.
* Share best practices across all areas of the business. Support plants in implementation.
* Strong technical and problem-solving foundation with knowledge of structured problem-solving methods (e.g. 8-D, A3, etc.)
* Excellent knowledge of ISO 9001, IATF 16949, Customer Specific Requirements AIAG Core Tools and AIAG CQI Assessments. IATF 16949 Lead Auditor (Preferred).
* Experience in Compliant Pro and SAP (Preferred). Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint is required.
* Travel will be required in this role and should be expected at least twice per month. A minimum of three (3) travel days per travel week is to be expected. The position reports out of a home office given network responsibility.

 **Care, Courage, & Collaboration**


At Hydro We care about our People!


We care about Safety!

  

Hydro is heading in a new and exciting direction, and we depend on different perspectives to solve our tasks and meet customer needs. Building on our three core values – Care, Courage and Collaboration – we target a high performing and sustainable work environment based on inclusion of our differences. Hydro in North America is an Equal Opportunity Employer where all phases of employment are based strictly upon the qualifications of the individual as related to the work requirements of the position. This policy is applied without regard to race, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, veteran status, marital status or any other category protected by law.

title: Automotive Practice Lead-Systems Engineering Services
description:
Drive the development of safe and reliable automotive systems with 15+ years of V&V, functional safety, and systems engineering expertise.  
Spearhead the technical direction and execution for V&V, functional safety, and systems engineering within our Automotive Solutions and Services practice.

**Responsibilities**:  
\\* Define and implement comprehensive V&V (HIL/SIL/MIL/XIL/Simulation/Test Automation) and functional safety strategies and solutions across projects, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations.  
\\* Oversee the execution of V&V and functional safety processes, leading activities like hazard identification, risk assessment, and mitigation plan development.  
\\* Champion systems engineering methodologies, guiding projects from concept to production with a focus on system-wide optimization and integration.  
\\* Provide in-depth technical guidance and support to project teams, ensuring seamless integration of V&V and functional safety considerations throughout the development lifecycle.  
\\* Stay at the forefront of industry trends and standards in V&V, functional safety, and systems engineering, actively seeking and proposing innovative solutions.  
\\* Build strong relationships with key stakeholders including clients, partners, and regulatory bodies.  
\\* Represent the organization at industry events and conferences, sharing expertise and fostering thought leadership.

**Qualifications**:  
\\* 15+ years of progressive experience in automotive V&V, functional safety, and systems engineering.  
\\* Proven track record of successfully leading and executing complex technical projects with HIL, SIL, MIL, XIL, Simulation and Test Automation. Ability to build and manage test benches  
\\* In-depth understanding of industry standards and regulations related to V&V and functional safety (e.g., ISO 26262, ASIL).  
\\* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and address potential risks and issues.  
\\* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills, effective in both technical and non-technical environments.  
\\* Strategic thinking and a collaborative approach, fostering cross-functional teamwork and knowledge sharing.  
\\* Passion for quality, innovation, and continuous improvement in the automotive industry.

Make a significant impact on the development of next-generation automotive solutions.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $150,000.00 - $250,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Employee discount
* Health insurance

Experience level:

* 11+ years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: Remote

title: Software Engineer (L5), Consumer ML Model Serving Systems
description:
Remote, United States
Core Engineering
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service, with over 230 million paid members in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, feature films, and games across numerous genres and languages. Members can watch or play as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen.  

Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence powers all of our consumer experience, including content discovery and personalization, identifying and attracting new members to our product, optimizing our payment processing, and much more.  

The Opportunity
The Consumer ML Serving team provides the computational platform on which nearly all our consumer-facing ML/AI applications are built. If you’ve seen it, we probably served it! We provide all the building blocks to serve ML at scale, including a real-time serving platform, an event-driven model and feature compute framework, a distributed cluster orchestration engine, and more.  

We are looking for a strong technical lead to own and develop our long-term vision. Our systems power some of the most business-critical models at Netflix, and we need you to take our ML/AI initiatives to the next level. You will play a highly cross-functional role, partnering with other engineers, product managers, machine learning engineers, and data/research scientists.  

If you have a passion for building scalable, robust systems, are interested in pushing the envelope in applied ML algorithms, and enjoy seeing a direct line between your work and what our customers see on their screens, then we want to talk to you.**You may enjoy working with us if you are:**
---------------------------------------------

* Able to solve ambiguous problems and deliver top-tier solutions.
* Eager to learn about new domains and ship high-quality, well-tested code.
* Able to produce generic and optimal solutions while balancing near-term needs.
* Excited to work in a multidisciplinary environment (engineering, algorithms, data engineering/science, product experimentation).
* Comfortable working in a majority-remote team with partners distributed across (US) geographies & time zones.
* Willing to take broad ownership of team responsibilities (building roadmaps, scoping, task breakdowns, etc.)
**We would especially love to work with you if have experience with:**
----------------------------------------------------------------------

* Building high-traffic, real-time distributed systems and ML infrastructure.
* Supporting large-scale ML models with a direct impact on what customers see.
* Translating the requirements of research scientists into generic platform offerings.
* Delivering systems requiring high availability, throughput, and performance.
* Navigating highly ambiguous environments.
* Taking on and executing zero-to-one projects.
* Leading projects with 3-4 other engineers.
* Building applications in an object-oriented programming language. (We work primarily with Java, and while prior Java experience is not required to interview, you will be expected to become proficient on the job.)
* DevOps for large applications, including performance tuning, optimization, deployment management, and capacity planning.
* Public cloud like AWS, Azure, or GCP.
**…and if:**
------------

* You are a proactive, effective communicator and have a strong bias towards action.
* You have a BS/MS in Computer Science, Applied Math, Engineering, or a related field.

What do we offer?
Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $100,000 - $720,000.  

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.  

Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

title: IT Systems Engineer
description:
**ABOUT US**

**A Specialty Path to Good Health**


Upperline Health is the nation’s largest provider dedicated to lower extremity, wound and vascular care. Founded in 2017 with the ambitious goal of changing specialty care, Upperline Health delivers a more efficient path for patients to receive consistent and effective treatment for chronic illnesses.

**Triage is temporary.**

**Treatment is transformative.**


Upperline Health providers coordinate patients’ care among a team of specialists – physicians, advanced practice providers, care navigators, pharmacists, dieticians, and social workers for integrated treatment that addresses patients’ immediate and long-term health needs.

**We put patients at the center of value-based care.**

 **ABOUT THE IT SYSTEMS ENGINEER - HEALTHCARE**  

Upperline Health is seeking a highly motivated and experienced IT Systems Engineer to join our growing IT team. In this role, you will play a key role in supporting our critical healthcare systems and ensuring their reliability, performance, and security. Upperline is looking for strong performers who are self-starters, problem solvers, have exceptional attention to detail, and who are eager to tackle problems and tasks, both big and small. You should have the ability to adapt and thrive in a fast-changing growth environment.

 **What You’ll Do**

* Design, implement and manage Windows and Linux systems and Azure cloud environments for our healthcare organization.
* Lead Microsoft 365 administration, migration initiatives, and tenant-to-tenant transitions.
* Provide excellent technical support to clinics, doctors, and nurses.
* Migrate legacy EMR systems and on-prem data centers to standard and cloud services.
* Maintain cybersecurity protections adhering to healthcare compliance regulations.
* Identify and remediate system vulnerabilities and risk assessments.
* Troubleshoot and resolve minor to major hardware, software, and networking issues.
* Identify process improvement opportunities across the organization leveraging technology systems and solutions.
* Maintain inventory requirements for all end user devices.
* Assist in identifying resolution gaps within technology.
* Support and maintain effective relationships with multiple levels throughout the organization.
* Act as a primary contributor or manager on projects and special assignments.
* Maintain and create company knowledge base articles.
* Work with external vendors or contractors (existing and new) with limited supervision.
* Develop technical training content and present to team members across the organization.
* Document IT processes, procedures and infrastructure through PowerShell/Python scripts.
* Research latest healthcare technologies and trends in cloud, networking, and security.

**Qualifications of the IT Systems Engineer**

* 2+ years in healthcare IT administration, preferably in a clinic/hospital environment; Microsoft certifications highly preferred.
* Strong administration and troubleshooting experience with healthcare IT systems - EMRs, PACs, telehealth platforms, etc.
* 2+ years administering Microsoft Azure environments.
* Expert in Microsoft 365 administration and migration tasks.
* Extensive experience porting email platforms, networks, and hardware.
* Expertise in Azure AD, SQL, PowerShell, and Python scripting.
* Exceptional customer support mentality with some help desk exposure.
* Creative problem-solver who takes initiative and works independently.
* Passion for staying on top of healthcare IT/security innovations.
* Multi-year experience managing ticketing systems and workflow management
* Experience with:
	+ Supporting remote users
	+ Mobile Device Management (MDM) applications (Meraki, Jamf, & InTune)
	+ Maintaining and monitoring enterprise level security patching
	+ Popular project management methodologies (Agile, Waterfall, ITIL)
	+ Working in a hybrid environment of on-premises and cloud-based systems
* Senior experience with:
	+ Multiple operating systems (Windows, iOS, OSx, Android, Linux)
	+ Microsoft Endpoint Manager leveraging AutoPilot and other advanced features
	+ API Integrations across multiple products & platforms
* Ability to work a flexible schedule as needed, which could include working after or before business hours.
* Project Management experience is a plus.

 **BENEFITS**  

Competitive benefit options include comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, 401K (matching), PTO and parental leave.

 **COMPENSATION**  

Compensation is commensurate to compensation for similar positions in the region and based on prior training and experience.

  

  

Job Type: Full-time
