title: Systems Engineer (Remote)
description:
Since 1978, ACS Technologies (“ACST”) has served the faith-based community, building software to help ministries lead with less stress and more accuracy. ACST enables churches to handle every vital area of their ministry from finances to relationships. We're now the leader in the industry but we've got more work to do, and we need the right talent on board to help with our mission of serving churches with tomorrow's technology.


The Systems Engineer (SEM) provides assistance in implementation, testing, debugging, documenting, and the management of Managed Services customer facing systems and devices. The SEM also integrates data across these systems to meet the dynamic needs of the business. The SEM is accountable for maintaining approved standards and quality within his/her team and contributing to these across all teams. The SEM is responsible for resolving standard and high level issues while increasing his or her technical know-how and expertise. **What You’ll Do:*** Independently resolves standard level customer issues, assists on projects, provides technical expertise, and contributes to the IT community.
* Maintains and improves quality of customer facing systems.
* Monitors and implements preventative actions to keep unplanned downtime at a minimum.
* Researches and implements updates and upgrades as appropriate.
* Documents systems administered in a timely, accurate manner and maintains appropriate visibility in managed systems.
* Assists in implementing new and better tools and methodologies.

 **What We’re Looking For:*** BS in Computer Science or related, with 3-5 years of systems administration or engineering experience, or an equivalent mix of education and experience.
* Has experience in at least one of the three areas below, with proven working knowledge in the remaining:
	+ Server and or systems administration
	+ Network administration
	+ 3rd party cloud computing design and implementation
* Experience with ConnectWise is preferred, specifically ConnectWise Manage (PSA) and ConnectWise Automate.
* Proven technical skills and the ability to communicate technical ideas to diverse individuals.
* Ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues in Windows and Apple operating systems. Most experience with Apple would be a plus.

 **Why You Want to Work Here:*** Outstanding benefits package, including 6% 401(k) match
* Free Wellness Clinic staffed by a Nurse Practitioner
* A caring, friendly work environment
* The opportunity to positively impact ministries

  

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Microsoft Systems Engineer
description:
As a Microsoft Engineer, your focus will be to represent US Cloud in communications via onsite, phone, email, and web to assist clients and partners in deploying, operating, and troubleshooting Microsoft technologies such as Windows server and desktop, Office 365, Azure, SharePoint, Exchange, SQL, Skype, System Center and Dynamics. You will have the opportunity to foster positive client relationships while effectively managing challenging situations and driving client success.  

  



**Location: Remote, US**

  

* This position is not eligible to be performed in New York, Colorado, Oregon or California.

 **Responsibilities:**


* Obtain high client and partner onboarding and ticket satisfaction.
* Drive client success and adoption of Microsoft technologies.
* Reduce time and cost to onboard and resolve tickets.
* Provide high-quality data to help drive service improvement.
* Serve as an escalation point for client tickets.
* Participate in proactive account management, spot performance issues, analyze problems and develop solutions to meet client needs.
* Provide effective service delivery by analyzing trends and common themes across clients.
* Create deliverables to address common client needs and support mobile-first, cloud-first strategy.
* Engage in strategic service delivery planning to strengthen targeted client relationships.
* Gather client impressions of products and services and integrate this feedback into decision-making.
* Allocate and align resources to optimize the client experience.
* Develop and communicate realistic performance goals and standards.
* Build plans that consider potential obstacles and immediate and long-term consequences.
* Provide stakeholder assistance throughout the deployment to avoid or resolve technical issues.
* Seek opportunities to drive business results through collaboration with the team.
* Articulate business value and grow client/partner relationships.
* Provide and drive actionable feedback across groups about the client/partner experience and competitor threats.
* Modify existing or create new intellectual property.
* Contribute to client change management and initiative adoption.
* Understand client requirements and map the adoption and optimization of Microsoft solutions accordingly.
* Contribute and participate in meetings to articulate offerings to all clients.
* Cultivate relationships, credibility, and loyalty with clients and partners intentionally by sharing relevant business expertise.

 **Basic Qualifications:**


* 8+ years of experience in Microsoft technologies.
* 5+ years of experience in Windows Server.
* Experience in Active Directory/Azure AD and DNS.
* Experience in technical writing.
* Proven ability to work virtually.
* Analytical and problem-solving mindset.
* Comfortable communicating with audiences varying in size.


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Relevant certifications in Microsoft technologies.


**Education/Training:**


* A degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Business, or a related field or equivalent work experience.


**Company Paid Benefits**  

* FREE Medical through our HSA plan
* Life Insurance of 1x salary
* Short Term and Long-Term Disability
* Employee Assistance Program
* Unlimited PTO – Paid Time Off

**Additional Benefits Offered**  

* Medical PPO plan
* Dental & Vision coverage
* 401k with match
* Legal Shield

**Perks**  

* Gym membership stipend
* Employee referral program
* Stipend for Engineering on-call rotations
* Home office buildout reimbursement
* Continuing professional education
* Casual dress
 *US Cloud is an equal-opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, dietary preferences, gender, sexual orientation, age, fashion sense, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or political leanings. Come as you are.*

title: Batch Systems Engineer
description:
**Role description:** 

The Batch Systems Engineer is responsible for all the glass batch processes in Ardagh Glass Packaging -NA from incoming raw materials to batch feeding into the furnace. This role will reside within the Glass Technology team and support the company's 12 operating facilities. This position will be responsible for batch house auditing, troubleshooting, ongoing improvement projects, and design of existing and future batch house operations in North American facilities.

**Responsibilities:** 

* Audit existing batch house operations
* Determine batch house timings and capabilities
* Identify bottlenecks and improvements in projects
* Develop and oversee major repairs/projects in the batch house area for improved operation
* Create and audit both new and existing TOP's and SOP's for batch house operation
* Collaborate with the plants and corporate Glass Technology, batch and furnace, and project management teams on batch house improvements
* Develop catalogs of critical parts and systems
* Develop maintenance programs in the FIIX system for integral parts of the batch house systems
* Develop programs to minimize batch house downtime
* Develop and mentor plant personnel
* Work with the Environmental Engineering team on the optimization of existing emissions-decreasing systems
* Work with 3rd party vendors and communicate on project milestones

**Minimum skills / qualifications:** 

* Bachelor's degree in material science, mechanical engineering, or a related field
* Five (5) years of experience in operational engineering or batch house design
* Knowledge in raw material unloading, storage, weigh systems, and conveyance
* Knowledge of mechanical and electrical batch house systems
* Ability to perform detailed batch house audits
* Effective project management skills
* Knowledge and deep understanding of control systems
* Ability to work in a servant leadership capacity
* Ability to travel up to 75%

**Preferred skills / qualifications:** 

* Master's degree in material science, mechanical engineering, or a related field
* PMP certificate
* Ten (10) years of experience in operational engineering or batch house design

**About Ardagh Group**  
Ardagh Glass Packaging is a global leader in glass packaging solutions, producing packaging for the world’s leading brands. We trace our roots all the way back to the Irish Glass Bottle Company, founded in 1932. Since then, we have grown rapidly to a team of more than 20,000 people with revenues of over $9 billion. Today we have a presence across Europe, Africa, and North America.

* Did you know that Ardagh produce many of the beverage cans and bottles you drink your favorite beverages from?
* Did you know we produce metal and glass packaging which are permanent materials, meaning they can be infinitely recycled without any loss of quality?
* Did you know we produce more than 160 million containers per day?

Ardagh is passionate about sustainability and have a reputation for innovation. We push the boundaries of what’s possible, pioneering new production methods, new design techniques and new ways to recycle and save energy. Our aim is to reduce any negative environmental impact while remaining economically sustainable and socially responsible. We believe that the success of our business depends on the success of our people. We strive to create working environments where our employees feel valued, can work to their full potential, and where their achievements are celebrated. Here at Ardagh, we offer exciting and rewarding opportunities for talented and creative people. If you have ambition and want to make an impact with your career, come and join our team, you’ll enjoy the journey!

**Benefits Offered**

* Medical, prescription, dental and vision plans
* Health Savings Account (HSA) and Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
* Life insurance
* 401(k) retirement plan with company match and an employer retirement contribution
* Paid holidays, floating days and vacation
* Short- and Long-Term Disability (STD/LTD)
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Tuition reimbursement program
* Professional and personal development opportunities through Employee Resource Groups
* Benefits available from day 1 of employment
* Flexible and hybrid working hours

Ardagh Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other basis prohibited by federal, state, and local law.

Ardagh Group complies with federal, state, and local disability laws and makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. Contact Clare McHugh (clare.mchugh@ardaghgroup.com) if a reasonable accommodation is needed.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $110,000.00 - $130,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* On call

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* glass batch house projects: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: IT Engineering System Support Analyst (Remote)
description:
In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next!
When it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at Parsons. Imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. Imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. Where you can thrive. Where you can find your next, right now. We’ve got what you’re looking for.
**Job Description:**

Parsons is looking for an amazingly talented **Engineering Systems Support Analyst** to join our team! In this role you will get to **provide technical support to employees that are utilizing CAD, BIM and 3D design software packages** .


**What You'll Be Doing:**

* Provide general troubleshooting and system maintenance required for advanced workstations employed for CAD and engineering production.
* Address daily support requests from end users forwarded by the IS Service Desk. Refers complex issues, questions and problems to more senior ES team members.
* Apply knowledge of advanced workstations to troubleshoot hardware and configuration issues (graphic adaptors, driver configuration, etc).
* Participate in regular upgrades, modifications or enhancements to existing ES systems and with implementation of new ES systems.
* Install and configure ES-related software applications to meet requirements established by a project.
* Assist other Parsons IT teams (e.g. desktop support team) with set up and support of Parsons ES delivery system (Appsetra).
* Identify advanced issues, questions and problems and elevates those to ES Analyst or Senior Analyst.

**What Required Skills You'll Bring:**

* Associate's Degree in Computer Science, information systems, engineering or related technical discipline, with experience in both engineering and IT. and 2+ years of progressive experience working in one or more of the following areas: engineering, design, architecture, application systems
* Written and oral communication skills appropriate for the position, including the ability to speak well in basic professional situations.
* Ability to write basic documents (may include email or memos).
* CAD, BIM and 3D design software packages
* General knowledge of engineering and design applications such as AutoCAD, MicroStation, ProjectWise™

**What Desired Skills You'll Bring:**

* Knowledge of advanced computer hardware, such as 2D and 3D workstations utilized for engineering and design operations and production.
* Familiar with standard systems and tools that provide ES problem resolution and tracking.
* Working knowledge of computer-aided engineering, tools and methodology.
* Ability to work effectively with end users and as a member of the ES team.
* Written and oral communication skills appropriate for the position.

**Minimum Clearance Required to Start:**

Not Applicable/None
This position is part of our Corporate team.
We’re driving the future of the national security and critical infrastructure markets. Our employees work in a close-knit team environment to find new, innovative ways to deliver smart solutions that are used and valued by customers around the world. By combining unique technologies with deep domain expertise across cybersecurity, missile defense, space, connected infrastructure, transportation, smart cities, and more, we're providing tomorrow's solutions today.
Salary Range:


$28.51 - $49.90
We value our employees and want our employees to take care of their overall wellbeing, which is why we offer best-in-class benefits such as medical, dental, vision, paid time off, Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP), 401(k), life insurance, flexible work schedules, and holidays to fit your busy lifestyle!
The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by customer requirements and some cases federal, state, provincial or local mandates.


This position will be posted for a minimum of 3 days and will continue to be posted for an average of 30 days until a qualified applicant is selected or the position has been cancelled.
Parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility in the workplace. Diversity is ingrained in who we are, how we do business, and is one of our company’s core values. Parsons equally employs representation at all job levels for minority, female, disabled, protected veteran and LGBTQ+.
We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!

title: Senior Sales (Systems)Engineer (SoCal)
description:
**About Us:**
-------------


Join the team at OpenDrives, a rapidly growing data services company that is dedicated to solving complex technology problems with innovative yet practical solutions. Our customers range from Hollywood blockbusters, to medical imaging specialists, to academia, and everything in between. Our company's core values are summed up in the word OPEN, which stands for open-mindedness, persistence, effectiveness, and nimbleness. We are looking for empathetic, self-starting professionals who are passionate about exceeding customer expectations and who thrive in a collaborative, supportive environment. If you're a curious listener, with a commitment to excellence, and want to be part of an organization that is dedicated to solving real-world data management challenges, we invite you to apply to join our team today.

**About the Role:**
-------------------


We are looking for an experienced Senior Sales Systems Engineer based in Southern California with a familiarity, focus, and understanding of Media and Entertainment workflows to join our Sales Engineering Team. The Senior Sales (Systems) Engineer is pivotal in engaging with customers, prospects, and channel partners externally, while internally collaborating with all departments, notably Sales, Product, and Channel teams. As a senior role, this individual will practice autonomy and should require minimal management oversight for day to day tasks. This individual will also leverage their technical expertise to understand and address customer needs, facilitate seamless communication between internal teams, and drive sales growth by effectively showcasing OpenDrives' solutions through demos. This role requires a deep understanding of industry trends and a proactive approach to aligning technical solutions with customer requirements.


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**
------------------------------------------


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the following satisfactorily; other duties may be assigned. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


* Fully listen to and analyze customer wants, needs, pain points, and business objectives and successfully translate them into a fully integrated technical solution.
* Provide technical expertise to facilitate growth in both employees and customers.
* Create the technical components, including diagrams, for presentations and proposals as applied to active sales opportunities.
* Anticipate and answer questions that will remove objections and move sales campaigns forward.
* Build relationships and become the trusted technology advisor to their customers.
* Deliver demos to convey the benefits of choosing OpenDrives' products and OpenDrives as a company.
* Works with their sales counterparts to align OpenDrives feature to customer ROI
* Complete and submit the technical portions of Requests for Proposals (RFPs) that OpenDrives participates in.
* Research competitive technologies when in a bake-off sales campaign.
* Provide feedback and feature requests to the Product and Engineering teams about new trends/shifts in technology
* Take the lead in communications and project management when a sales opportunity becomes a Proof of Concept (POC).
* Providing Technical Leadership both internally and externally.
* Have a clear understanding of the Open Drives Products and Roadmap.
* Keep themselves up to date with Industry Innovation and Direction.
* Must live in Southern California
* Occasional travel required for customer demos, conferences, and company events


**Competencies and Skills:**
----------------------------


To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following.


* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Excellent sales and customer service skills with a proven ability to explain technical products to non-technical audiences.
* Team player who embraces collaboration and thinking outside the box
* Ability to apply engineering, technology, or other related principles to product sales.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Able to adapt and respond to interrupt driven activities in a timely manner.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.


**Education and Experience:**
-----------------------------


* Bachelor's degree in Engineering or field related to products and services being sold preferred.
* Five to ten years of related product or sales experience required


**Physical Demands:**
---------------------


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee is frequently required to talk or hear; stand and walk. The employee must be able to occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. This job operates partially in a clerical, office setting, but also includes on-site visits to customer locations depending on the territory.

  

**Work Environment:**
---------------------


The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.


The above job description is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of duties and standards of the position. Incumbents will follow any other instructions, and perform any other related duties, as assigned by their supervisor.


**Benefits:**
-------------


We have some awesome perks if you want to work with us.


* Incredible vacation policy and flexible schedule
* Great health, dental, and vision insurance
* Employer and Employee Paid Life Insurance & AD&D Options
* Voluntary Short & Long Term Disability Options
* Flexible Spending Account/Health Savings Account Options
* Employee Assistance Program
* 401(k)
* Options for hybrid remote/office work, or full remote
* Cell Phone and Internet Allowance
* A culture of empathy and empowerment


**Pay Scale Disclaimer:**
-------------------------


The hiring salary for this role is $165,000.00 USD annually.


Please note that the compensation information provided is a good faith estimate for this position only and is provided pursuant to the California Salary Transparency in Job Advertisements Law. OpenDrives takes into consideration a candidate's education, training, and experience, external market and internal value, including seniority and merit systems, and internal pay alignment when determining the salary level for potential new employees. In compliance with the California Law, a potential new employee's salary history will not be used in compensation decisions.

title: Power Systems Engineer: Spring 2024 Grads
description:
Overview:
**We are designing the Grid of the****future**
We are innovators by nature**,** for over 50 years, Electric Power Engineers, LLC (EPE) has partnered with power and energy clients across the globe to focus on complex engineering and grid modeling challenges. As an early leader in the renewables space, we continue to see significant opportunities to build a sustainable and secure Grid. Join a team committed to making an impact on the communities we serve and the environment in which we live. Together we can continue to create the “grid of the future”!
Responsibilities:
**Join us in leading the** **change!**
This position is intended for **spring 2024 graduates** searching for **full time positions beginning in May.** **How you can make an impact:**
The Power Systems Engineer will be a member of an innovative teams within EPE. All positions will report to an experienced engineer and be exposed to exciting projects building valuable industry knowledge. Through this opportunity, you will gain hands-on experience and perform research in-line with study requirements. **Visit our** **services** **page to learn more about our teams and services.**  


Qualifications:
**Bring your passion, here's what’s needed:*** Proven team player with the ability to build and maintain internal and external relationships.
* Strong organizational and communication skills, both written and verbal, particularly with respect to explaining technical matters.
* Strong organizational, interpersonal, problem solving, and analytical skills.
* Capable of managing multiple tasks.
* Flexible with the ability to manage change.
* Have high standards in producing quality reports and products that he/she shall own with pride.
* Strong technical report writing skills.

**Staff I*** Bachelors degree in Electric Engineering with an emphasis in power systems

 **How we support you:*** Comprehensive health and wellness benefits including medical, dental, and vision with 100% premium coverage for you.
* Generous PTO and paid holidays
* Continuous Education Benefits
* Work with industry leaders
* 401K, up to a 4% match (100% vested from day 1)
* Flexible Work including hybrid and remote possibilities base on position.

  

 The position's location and travel is determined by the team the candidate has been selected for. *EPE is an equal opportunity/AA/Disability/Veteran employer. The EEO is the Law poster, and its supplement are available using the following links:* *EEOC is the Law Poster* *If you are interested in applying for employment with EPE and need special assistance to apply for a posted position, please send an email to:* *applicationassistance@epeconsulting.com* ***Third-Party Recruiting Notification****EPE does not accept unsolicited resumes from* ***third-party recruiters****. Any unsolicited third-party resumes forwarded by recruiters to EPE via our career page or to any of our managers or employees will be considered public information, may be treated as a direct application from the person identified in the resume, and will not be eligible for placement fee payment to the agency. EPE will not pay a fee to a third-party recruiter or agency* without a previously signed third-party agreement *and has not coordinated their recruiting activity with the appropriate member of the Talent Acquisition team.*

title: Enterprise Solutions Engineer
description:
As a Solutions Engineer, you will play a critical role in helping our customers understand the value of Asana. Through your deep product knowledge and expertise in how companies use and deploy SaaS applications, you will support our Sales team to ensure they constantly move towards a close. You'll gain an understanding of adjacent technologies and begin to architect how Asana fits within that ecosystem. Solution Engineers at Asana are entrepreneurial, creative individuals with a whole systems mindset. They enjoy solving ambiguous issues and seek to leave things better than they found them.



This role can either be fully remote depending on which US state you live in, or based in our San Francisco office with an office-centric hybrid schedule. Along with most Asanas, you'll work from this office in person on Mondays, Tuesdays, and Thursdays. Most Asanas have the option to work from home on Wednesdays and Fridays. If you're interviewing for this role, your Talent Acquisition Partner will share more about the in-office requirements.


**What you'll achieve**


* Be a key player in helping Asana achieve its revenue goals.
* Your work will directly impact the vision of the product.
* Provide technical expertise to help the customer achieve great things.
* Help to strategize the largest revenue opportunities at Asana.
* Position Asana's solution within the market space as a market leader.
* Position yourself as a trusted advisor for colleagues and customers.
* Work with internal product stakeholders to deliver customer feedback and deliver solutions back to the customer.
* Work cross-functionally with the entire business (Sales, Product, Security, User Operations, Customer Success, Engineering).


**About you**


* 4+ years in an Enterprise Sales Engineering role (or similar) in a SaaS environment.
* Experience with creating custom demos from scratch and running proof-of-concept motions which mirror a customer's needs.
* Demonstrated success dealing with ambiguity in a high-growth environment - capable of prioritizing complex workloads and demanding stakeholders.
* Inherent technical understanding of how systems integrate as well as the tooling and ecosystems around them.
* Familiarity with BI tools.
* Understanding of product development and product life cycle.
* Experience responding to technical questions and security requirements from customers.
* A storyteller who is comfortable presenting a company and product to anyone in any setting.


At Asana, we're committed to building teams that include a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills, as this is critical to helping us achieve our mission. If you're interested in this role and don't meet every listed requirement, we still encourage you to apply.


**What we'll offer**



Our comprehensive compensation package plays a big part in how we recognize you for the impact you have on our path to achieving our mission. We believe that compensation should be reflective of the value you create relative to the market value of your role. To ensure pay is fair and not impacted by biases, we're committed to looking at market value which is why we check ourselves and conduct a yearly pay equity audit.



For this role, the estimated base salary range will vary based on your location. Locations in the US are categorized into one of three geographic pay zones, and the ranges for the zones are as follows:


* Zone 1: $156,800 - $200,200.
* Zone 2: $141,000 - $180,600.
* Zone 3: $126,000 - $159,600.


The actual base salary will vary based on various factors, including market and individual qualifications objectively assessed during the interview process. The listed ranges above are a guideline, and the base salary range for this role may be modified.



In addition to base salary, your compensation package may include additional components such as equity, sales incentive pay (for most sales roles), and benefits. If you're interviewing for this role, speak with your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about the total compensation and benefits for this role.



We strive to provide equitable and competitive benefits packages that support our employees worldwide and include:


* Mental health, wellness & fitness benefits
* Career coaching & support
* Inclusive family building benefits
* Long-term savings or retirement plans
* In-office culinary options to cater to your dietary preferences


These are just some of the benefits we offer, and benefits may vary based on role, country, and local regulations. If you're interviewing for this role, speak with your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about the total compensation and benefits for this role.


**About us**



Asana helps teams orchestrate their work, from small projects to strategic initiatives. Millions of teams around the world rely on Asana to achieve their most important goals, faster. Asana has been named a Top 10 Best Workplace for 5 years in a row, is Fortune's #1 Best Workplace in the Bay Area, and one of Glassdoor's and Inc.'s Best Places to Work. After spending more than a year physically distanced, Team Asana is safely and mindfully returning to in-person collaboration, incorporating flexibility that adds hybrid elements to our office-centric culture. With 11+ offices all over the world, we are always looking for individuals who care about building technology that drives positive change in the world and a culture where everyone feels that they belong.



We believe in supporting people to do their best work and thrive, and building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive company is core to our mission. Our goal is to ensure that Asana upholds an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued, whether they are applying for an open position or working at the company. We provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by law. We also comply with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and similar laws in other locations.

title: Systems Engineer
description:
**Overview:** We are seeking highly qualified professionals that will contribute to our ongoing growth and success. The Cloud Systems Engineer is a fast-paced position in a rapid growth enterprise environment. The ideal candidate is a person that strives to achieve excellence backed by strong architectural, system design, and automation experience. The ideal candidate is a person that strives to achieve excellence backed by strong architectural, system design, and automation experience. We are looking for someone who is passionate about technology and pushing the envelope with cutting edge ideas and leaps in intuition. If you are looking to be a part of a team to move cloud technology, public, private and hybrid, to the next level this could be your next great adventure.

  


**Duties and Responsibilities:**


* Assumes responsibility for defining, implementing, and enforcing governance and standards for Microsoft Azure.
* Supports application engineering teams to design software applications, including the migration and transformation of legacy solutions to the cloud, that adhere to Inovalon policies for secure software development and cloud solutions.
* Applies commercial cloud best practices to design, develop, and implement Azure platform-level features.
* Develops infrastructure as code for user groups that rely on these services (e.g., automatic provisioning of accounts, environments, VPC configurations, security, networking, logging, and statistics visualization).
* Recommends process and architecture improvements.
* Collaborates with product, architecture, and security teams to ensure solutions respond to non-functional requirements such as availability, performance, security, and maintainability.
* Stays current with new technology options and vendor products, evaluating which ones would be a good fit for Inovalon.
* Adhere to all confidentiality and HIPAA requirements as outlined within CCS Operating Policies and Procedures in all ways and at all times with respect to any aspect of the data handled or services rendered in the undertaking of the position.
* Fulfill those responsibilities and/or duties that may be reasonably provided by Inovalon for the purpose of achieving operational and financial success of the Company; and
* Uphold responsibilities relative to the separation of duties for applicable processes and procedures within your job function.


**Job Requirements:**


* Minimum 3+ years of experience as a systems engineer, site reliability engineer, or cloud engineer.
* Extensive knowledge of existing industry standards, technologies, and infrastructure operations for Azure.
* Knowledge of automation and continuous integration/delivery tools such as Azure Pipelines, Terraform, Jenkins, or similar.

  

  

**Education:**


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, technical field, or equivalent experience.  

* 

**Physical Demands and Work Environment:**


* Sedentary work (i.e., sitting for long periods of time);
* Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or negligible amount of force;
* Frequently or constantly to lift, carry push, pull or otherwise move objects and repetitive motions;
* Subject to inside environmental conditions; and
* Travel for this position will include less than 5% locally usually for training purposes.


*The actual base pay offered may vary depending on multiple factors including, but not limited to, job-related knowledge/skills, experience, business needs, geographical location, and internal equity. At Inovalon, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top end of the range for their role, and compensation decisions are dependent upon the facts and circumstances of each position and candidate.*

**Base Compensation Range**


$69,858—$133,977.25 USD*Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they meet every one of the qualifications listed in a job description. If you don't meet every qualification listed but are excited about our mission and the work described, we encourage you to apply regardless. ComplexCare Solutions is most interested in finding the best candidate for the job and you may be just the right person for this or other roles.*

title: Systems Engineer
description:
Overview:

Atlassian helps teams everywhere to change the world through the power of software and we are looking for a Systems Engineer for Atlassian's Trust Systems Engineering Team. This team is responsible for building, deploying, and operating third party and internally built software systems to improve the entire company's security posture.


Responsibilities:

As a Systems Engineer, you will work with Trust and Security stakeholders to identity cutting edge tools and platforms, deploy them and manage them throughout their lifecycle. You will help identify and build solutions to enhance availability, performance and stability of Atlassian's security tools and services. You'll also respond to pings, pages and alerts to investigate issues in our services that will challenge and grow your technical abilities. You'll be working on non-production and production environments, monitoring, data collection and configuration management, as well as disaster recovery planning, capacity engineering, reliability improvement initiatives and platform automation. You will provide support to the users of our platforms and will help them resolve any challenges they may face with the systems we manage. The best person for this role is someone who likes to learn, enjoys collaboration with peers, always wants to help their customers, is inquisitive and wants to improve the world around them and has the desire to turn chaos into order.


This role would be a great fit for someone with creative and innovative problem-solving skills with a willingness to take responsibility for production systems. You will develop and implement solutions that operate at scale - seeing your own technology efforts directly improve the reliability of our security services.


If you are a systems engineer interested in developing your information security expertise, this role is a rare opportunity to do just that!


Qualifications:
### **Basic Qualifications**


On your first day, you will have experience in:

* Understanding and working experience with Linux/Unix systems
* Basic experience with AWS or other Cloud providers
* Entry-level programming experience in one or more languages (e.g. Bash, Python, Go)
* Experience troubleshooting on-prem and cloud native platforms and operating systems. (1+ years)
* Prior experience supporting internal or external customers

### **Preferred Qualifications**

* Experience in automation/configuration-as-code such as Ansible, Terraform, CloudFormation.
* Familiarity with general incident management principles
* Familiarity with continuous integration/delivery pipeline
* Responding to alerts, incidents and requests related to production services
* Ability to contribute to improving monitoring and alerting systems related to production services
* Experience supporting internal or external customers while maintaining established service level agreements
* Familiarity with information security systems would be a huge bonus, specifically Tenable.io, Stamus Suricata IDS, Tines, Crowdstrike, Lacework, or similar.

**Compensation**


At Atlassian, we strive to design equitable, explainable, and competitive compensation programs. To support this goal, the baseline of our range is higher than that of the typical market range, but in turn we expect to hire most candidates near this baseline. Base pay within the range is ultimately determined by a candidate's skills, expertise, or experience. In the United States, we have three geographic pay zones. For this role, our current base pay ranges for new hires in each zone are:


Zone A: $119,600 - $159,400


Zone B: $107,600 - $143,400


Zone C: $99,200 - $132,300


This role may also be eligible for benefits, bonuses, commissions, and equity.


Please visit go.atlassian.com/payzones for more information on which locations are included in each of our geographic pay zones. However, please confirm the zone for your specific location with your recruiter.

title: Sr. Cisco Voice/VOIP Engineer
description:
